characterAbstracts.desc: A fictional story of a band of five heroes who go off on a dragon hunt. It is poorly written and structurally incoherent. Its value lies in the many lessons that can be learned from failure.

characterAbstracts.name: Waster Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A sturdy sheet of iron that may be powerful enough to break apart mountains if wielded with enough willpower.

characterAbstracts.name: Sword of Descension
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword of unique craftsmanship. It does not appear to belong to this world.

characterAbstracts.name: Harbinger of Dawn
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword that once shone like the sun. The wielder of this sword will be blessed with a "feel-good" buff. The reflective material on the blade has long worn off.

characterAbstracts.name: The Black Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A pitch-black longsword that thirsts for violence and conflict. It is said that this weapon can cause its user to become drunk on the red wine of slaughter.

characterAbstracts.name: Dragonspine Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: A spear created from the fang of a dragon. It is oddly warm to the touch.

characterAbstracts.name: Missive Windspear
characterAbstracts.desc: A beacon that shows the direction of the wind. Not every idyll carried on the breeze remains a gentle thing...

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Milk Tooth
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Andrius' wolf pack is its blessed honor guard, and even the milk teeth of a wolf cub possess great potential.
In the past, the gods had the responsibility to love all people. Andrius was therefore quite unusual in that he became leader of the wolves, while only welcoming abandoned babies and wanderers when it came to humans.

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Nostalgia
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The Wolf King, believing himself to despise humans, thought himself unable to envision a happy life for humanity, making him unworthy of becoming the Lord of the Winds of the world. Therefore, he chose to disappear. Yet, in truth, he gazes on the ones abandoned by the world ever so gently.

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Broken Fang
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The wolf pack also understands that humans are not solitary creatures. The honorary broken tooth is a parting gift said to bring protection and luck.
In the legends of a far-off world, a female wolf once adopted two great humans. Their home was known as the Cave of Wolves, or Lupercal - that word meaning the same thing as Lupical does in this world.

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Cracked Tooth
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The life of a wolf is not without violence; broken bones or cracked teeth are nothing special.
Andrius found humans to be a disappointment, but believed babies to be innocent. If both the wolf pack and the adopted children chose each other, then they become a Lupical, a fated family.

characterAbstracts.name: Dori
characterAbstracts.desc: An elusive merchant who has a fondness for glittering Mora.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Dendro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Nahida
characterAbstracts.desc: A caged bird secluded within the confines of the Sanctuary of Surasthana who can only see the world in her dreams.

characterAbstracts.name: Layla
characterAbstracts.desc: A Rtawahist student who specializes in Theoretical Astrology. Heavily prone to somnambulism and locked in a grinding war with sleep deprivation, the problem of restful slumber is a most troubling one to her.

characterAbstracts.name: Alhaitham
characterAbstracts.desc: The current scribe of the Sumeru Akademiya, a man endowed with extraordinary intelligence and talent. He lives free — free from the searching eyes of ordinary people, anyway.

characterAbstracts.name: Kaveh
characterAbstracts.desc: A renowned architect from Sumeru who perhaps cares a bit too much about too many things. He is an aesthete troubled by reality.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Ingenuity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Ingenuity is the leaf-veins of the nation of wisdom.

Ingenuity springs forth from benevolent consideration. They say that "a poisonous tree bears no kind fruit." Similarly, ingenious nascent ideas are always born from determined and benign minds, for only they are worthy bearers of wisdom.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Ingenuity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Ingenuity is the leaf-veins of the nation of wisdom. Ingenuity sets words of integrity on the right path. One who thinks out of goodwill and in a clever and careful fashion never deviates from the path of boons. Yet one who thinks with contempt and malice shall taint their words with despicable colors.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Ingenuity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Ingenuity is the leaf-veins of the nation of wisdom.

Ingenuity is completed by harmonious conduct. What is done completes what is thought.

Wisdom blooms where the mind, words, and practice converge.

characterAbstracts.name: Kujou Sara
characterAbstracts.desc: A general of the Tenryou Commission. Bold, decisive, and skilled in battle.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Electro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Kamisato Ayato
characterAbstracts.desc: The young but highly accomplished head of the Yashiro Commission's Kamisato Clan. Cultured and polite, he is a man of many ways and means.

characterAbstracts.name: Kamisato Ayaka
characterAbstracts.desc: Daughter of the Yashiro Commission's Kamisato Clan. Dignified and elegant, as well as wise and strong.

characterAbstracts.name: Arataki Itto
characterAbstracts.desc: The first and greatest head of the Arataki Gang, famed throughout Inazuma City's Hanamizaka... Wait, what? You've never heard of them? Are you trying to be funny here?

characterAbstracts.name: Kuki Shinobu
characterAbstracts.desc: The capable and reliable deputy leader of the "Arataki Gang." Please note: capable and reliable are not appellations for the "Arataki Gang," but for their deputy leader in specific.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Elegance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Elegance is the form of the nation of thunder.
Elegance abhors vulgarity, and the elegant ever walk alone. Resisting base evils, unmoved by base loves, never taking refuge in base ignorance — that is how one perceives the chasm between the elegant and the contemptuous.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Elegance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Elegance is the form of the nation of thunder.
Elegance shuns arrogance. The elegant are ever humble, and only by discarding vanity and sloth may one see clearly — and is there not beauty and loveliness even in the basest of appearances?

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Elegance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Elegance is the form of the nation of thunder.
Elegance brooks no flattery, and the elegant are ever noble. They are like the sea eagles who soar on high to contend with the resounding storms. They will not cater to philistine vulgarity, as one would not cast a flower crown into the mud, staining its dignity.

characterAbstracts.name: Yun Jin
characterAbstracts.desc: A renowned Liyue opera singer who is skilled in both playwriting and singing. Her style is one-of-a-kind, exquisite and delicate, much like the person herself.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Kaedehara Kazuha
characterAbstracts.desc: A wandering samurai from Inazuma who is currently with Liyue's Crux Fleet. A gentle and carefree soul whose heart hides a great many burdens from the past.

characterAbstracts.name: Ganyu
characterAbstracts.desc: The secretary at Yuehai Pavilion. The blood of the qilin, an illuminated beast, flows within her veins.

characterAbstracts.name: Hu Tao
characterAbstracts.desc: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

characterAbstracts.name: Chongyun
characterAbstracts.desc: A young exorcist from a family of exorcists. He does everything he can to suppress his abundance of yang energy.

characterAbstracts.name: Xiangling
characterAbstracts.desc: A renowned chef from Liyue. She's extremely passionate about cooking and excels at making her signature hot and spicy dishes.

characterAbstracts.name: Yaoyao
characterAbstracts.desc: Streetward Rambler's youngest disciple. A gentle and caring "little adult."

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Diligence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Industriousness is the foundation of the land of Geo.
Industriousness is believing in one's own ability to earn a place in the land of the gods through sweat, wisdom, and power.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Diligence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Industriousness is the foundation of the land of Geo.
Industriousness is the catalyst that flows in the blood of the people of Liyue, able to turn rocks into gold. It is what lies behind the greatness of its great commercial port.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Diligence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Industriousness is the foundation of the land of Geo.
Diligence is having the bravery and the strength to conquer mountains and seas and to pursue gold and prosperity through honest, hard work.

characterAbstracts.name: Sapwood Blade
characterAbstracts.desc: It has taken on the shape of a blade that can cut down the foes of the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Forest Regalia
characterAbstracts.desc: It has taken on the shape of a greatsword that shall cut down the foes of the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Key of Khaj-Nisut
characterAbstracts.desc: One of a paired set of scepters fashioned from obsidian. They say that this can be used as a key to open the gate to a paradise that lies at the end of the ocean of sand.

characterAbstracts.name: Xiphos' Moonlight
characterAbstracts.desc: This ancient double-edged sword glimmers with moonlight. It is said that a now-silent Jinni dwells within it.

characterAbstracts.name: Light of Foliar Incision
characterAbstracts.desc: The gilded blade was made using precious white branches. It was once used to destroy countless poisons that infested the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Ibis Piercer
characterAbstracts.desc: A golden bow forged from the description in the story. If you use it as a normal weapon, you can also view it as a part of a fictional world that has made it off the pages.

materialAbstracts.name: Copper Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

Under the instructions of the First Sage, the ancestors of the forest people made these talismans using withered trees to commemorate the Lord of Verdure.

The talisman's shape was inspired by the forest dew. It symbolizes the permeation of wisdom into mortal minds.

materialAbstracts.name: Iron Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

Later, the Lord of Verdure taught people the mystery of the forging of black iron. The innocent mortals thus grasped the knowledge of using fire to forge blades.

The Lord of Verdure took pleasure in their knowledge - Lethal as fire and blades were to her, they made ordinary people powerful.

materialAbstracts.name: Silver Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

In the myriad lore of the forest, the one in the striped cape that resembled blazing flames was the Greater Lord of the Labyrinths and the Owner of the Moon-Mirrored Spring.

When he bowed his head and struck up a friendship with the Lord of Verdure, the tokens of their friendship were the gems that glimmered like water and silver that gleamed like the moonlight.

To repay such a gesture, the Lord of Verdure promised to keep secrets for the Greater Lord of the Labyrinths and safeguard the intricate and beautiful dreams of the rainforest.

No one could have foretold that the magnificent mansion of secrets and dreams would later fade away amidst the shroud of the dark flame of oblivion, after which its ash returned to the soil and became nutrients for the virgin rainforests.

materialAbstracts.name: Golden Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

"Mortals hold dear three things only: the spring water that embraces the moonlight, verdant life, and ageless youth..."

The nature of "wisdom" is not domination over all minds or scheming to gain all the benefit.

Instead, it is about empowering even ordinary beings to one day overcome their imposed constraints.

Though the roar of the tiger is no longer heard in the forest and the resilient guardians would seclude themselves within the dreams of children... On the night when every secret golden seal is lifted and all dreams glow like amber in the moonlight, perhaps she and her beloved people will eventually win genuine freedom.

characterAbstracts.name: Everlasting Moonglow
characterAbstracts.desc: A string of lovely jasper from the deep sea. It shines with a pure radiance like that of the moon, and just as ever-distant.

characterAbstracts.name: Amenoma Kageuchi
characterAbstracts.desc: A blade custom made for a famed samurai who could strike down a tengu warrior, known for their incredible agility, in midair.

characterAbstracts.name: Akuoumaru
characterAbstracts.desc: The beloved sword of the legendary "Akuou." The blade is huge and majestic, but is surprisingly easy to wield.

characterAbstracts.name: Hakushin Ring
characterAbstracts.desc: A catalyst that carries the memory of the Kitsune Saiguu of ancient times. However, this device is but an impoverished vessel for the full breadth of her thought.

characterAbstracts.name: Oathsworn Eye
characterAbstracts.desc: A national treasure of Byakuyakoku stored in the Dainichi Mikoshi. With the coming of the Serpent God, this item was used to notarize great oaths and wishes.

characterAbstracts.name: Mistsplitter Reforged
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword that blazes with a fierce violet light. The name "Reforged" comes from it having been broken once before.

characterAbstracts.name: Uraku Misugiri
characterAbstracts.desc: This famous blade was once created by the hand of Urakusai, the renowned literatus. Legend has it that it has never cut any living creature in all these hundreds of years.

materialAbstracts.name: Jeweled Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
This coral cannot be found anywhere in Teyvat, but was a gift that the great serpent obtained when it broke into the Dark Sea. For that abyssal snake, to be filled with coral was to be mighty, and its power would be shaved away as those corals were lost. In other words, those corals contain power far beyond the norm.

materialAbstracts.name: Jade Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Fleeing into the Dark Sea, the god that had lost everything met the abandoned people who had nothing within the ocean depths. Thus it elected to remain and become their "Orobashi no Mikoto," their "Watatsumi Omikami."
It is said that the great snake god once broke off all the coral branches on its body to give light to the children who were curled up in the darkness. They also say that it used these coral branches to create a huge ladder to allow those children to once again reach the surface and see the light of day.

materialAbstracts.name: Coral Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Watatsumi Island is the furthest from Narukami Island in the Inazuman island chain, and its name means "the god of the oceans" in the island's ancient tongue. Legend has it that when the great serpent first arose within the abyssal nation of ever-night, its fluorescent body was covered in myriad-colored coral.

materialAbstracts.name: Golden Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The meaning that lies behind the name "Watatsumi" is simply the unrequited hopes that the abandoned people who dwelt in the deep sea pinned upon the serpent god that led them.
And it was also because the serpent god now had people who worshiped it that it stayed in the world it should have long fled, breaking off the coral branches that adorned its body, treading upon land where it should not have, and facing a foe it could never hope to match — till at last, its divine form was sundered along with the mountains, its ichor turned into plasma, and its will and power became a curse that could never be extinguished: Tatarigami.

characterAbstracts.name: Solar Pearl
characterAbstracts.desc: A dull, golden pearl made of an unknown substance that harbors the light of the sun and the moon and pulses with a warm strength.

characterAbstracts.name: Lion's Roar
characterAbstracts.desc: A sharp blade with extravagant carvings that somehow does not compromise on durability and sharpness. It roars like a lion as it cuts through the air.

characterAbstracts.name: Lithic Blade
characterAbstracts.desc: A greatsword carved and chiseled from the very bedrock of Liyue.

characterAbstracts.name: Primordial Jade Winged-Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: A jade polearm made by the archons, capable of slaying ancient beasts.

characterAbstracts.name: Rust
characterAbstracts.desc: A completely rusted iron greatbow. The average person would lack the strength to even lift it, let alone fire it.

characterAbstracts.name: Slingshot
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow, despite the name. After countless experiments and improvements to the design, the creator of the ultimate slingshot found himself to have made what was actually a bow.

characterAbstracts.name: Summit Shaper
characterAbstracts.desc: A symbol of a legendary pact, this sharp blade once cut off the peak of a mountain.

characterAbstracts.name: Dark Iron Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A perfectly ordinary iron sword, just slightly darker than most.

characterAbstracts.name: Crescent Pike
characterAbstracts.desc: An exotic weapon with an extremely long blade on the top and a crescent blade at the bottom. It found its way into Liyue through foreign traders. With practice, it can deal heavy damage.

characterAbstracts.name: Whiteblind
characterAbstracts.desc: An exotic sword with one section of the blade left blunt. It made its way into Liyue via the hands of foreign traders. Incredibly powerful in the hands of someone who knows how to use it.

characterAbstracts.name: White Tassel
characterAbstracts.desc: A standard-issue weapon of the Millelith soldiers. It has a sturdy shaft and sharp spearhead. It's a reliable weapon.

characterAbstracts.name: Emerald Orb
characterAbstracts.desc: A catalyst carved out of the hard jade from Jueyun Karst north of Liyue. Small, light, and durable, it is known more colloquially as the "jade ball."

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Warbow
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow made of blackcliff that features extremely sturdy bow limbs. It requires an archer with a strong bow arm to use.

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Agate
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious catalyst made of a material known as "blackcliff." It has an ominous crimson glow that seems to pulse in synchronization with the tremors from deep within the earth.

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Longsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword made of a material known as "blackcliff." It has a dark crimson glow on its black blade.

characterAbstracts.name: Aqua Simulacra
characterAbstracts.desc: This longbow's color is unpredictable. Under the light, it takes on a lustrous, watery blue.

materialAbstracts.name: Luminous Sands from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The stone pillars that tower amid Guyun Stone Forest were once the stone spears Morax used to defeat his enemies. Over time, the gods' substance has seeped into the pillars that pin them down, lending them divine power. The pillars sometimes shed fragments of hatred and curses.

materialAbstracts.name: Relic from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The stone spear has a glimmering core formed by the power of the defeated gods. Their hatred is not directed at Morax, however, for they have lost themselves a long time ago and are incapable of holding personal grudges.

materialAbstracts.name: Divine Body from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
That which lurks within and animates this relic are the divine remains of lamenting gods. They are unrealized ideals, designs for a prosperous humanity that could never be. They may now lie deep within stone and sea, but they will not go quietly into the night.

materialAbstracts.name: Lustrous Stone from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The learned know that Guyun Stone Forest is far more than simply a miraculous sight on the sea to behold: It is the cemetery of the former gods of Liyue. Hatred and filth have periodically risen up from it, but all have been subdued by a demon-conquering young man.

characterAbstracts.name: Cool Steel
characterAbstracts.desc: A reliable steel-forged weapon that serves as a testament to the great adventures of its old master.

characterAbstracts.name: Pocket Grimoire
characterAbstracts.desc: A carefully compiled notebook featuring the essentials needed to pass a magic exam.

characterAbstracts.name: Apprentice's Notes
characterAbstracts.desc: Notes left behind by a top student. Many useful spells are listed, and the handwriting is beautiful.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Grimoire
characterAbstracts.desc: A book that once belonged to a court mage of Mondstadt who served the nobility. It contains faithful and comprehensive historical accounts as well as magic spells.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Longsword
characterAbstracts.desc: An old longsword that belonged to the erstwhile rulers of Mondstadt. Exquisitely crafted, the carvings and embellishments testify to the stature of its owner.

characterAbstracts.name: Mitternachts Waltz
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow painted the color of transgression and nights of illusion.

characterAbstracts.name: The Alley Flash
characterAbstracts.desc: A straight sword as black as the night. It once belonged to a thief who roamed the benighted streets.

characterAbstracts.name: Song of Broken Pines
characterAbstracts.desc: A greatsword as light as the sigh of grass in the breeze, yet as merciless to the corrupt as a typhoon.

characterAbstracts.name: The Stringless
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow that once served as an extraordinary instrument. It is no longer capable of getting people up and dancing.

characterAbstracts.name: The Viridescent Hunt
characterAbstracts.desc: A pure green hunting bow. This once belonged to a certain hunter whose home was the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A standard-issue longsword of the Knights of Favonius. When you're armed with this agile and sharp weapon, channeling the power of the elements has never been so easy!

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Codex
characterAbstracts.desc: A secret tome that belonged to the scholars of the Knights of Favonius. It describes the logic and power of elements and matter.

characterAbstracts.name: Cinnabar Spindle
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword made from materials that do not belong in this world. The power within might even be able to withstand the corruption of a venom that could corrode a mighty dragon.

characterAbstracts.name: The Bell
characterAbstracts.desc: A heavy greatsword. A clock is embedded within it, though its internal mechanisms have long been damaged.

characterAbstracts.name: Ferrous Shadow
characterAbstracts.desc: A replica of the famed sword of Arundolyn, the Lion of Light. Feel the power of a legendary hero as you hold this sword in your hand! Imagine yourself as the great warrior himself! Note: Daydreaming not recommended in live combat.

characterAbstracts.name: Silver Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword for exorcising demons. Everyone knows it's made of a silver alloy, not pure silver.

characterAbstracts.name: Snow-Tombed Starsilver
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient greatsword that was stored between frescoes. Forged from Starsilver, it has the power to cleave through ice and snow.

characterAbstracts.name: Aquila Favonia
characterAbstracts.desc: The soul of the Knights of Favonius. Millennia later, it still calls on the winds of swift justice to vanquish all evil — just like the last heroine who wielded it.

characterAbstracts.name: Magic Guide
characterAbstracts.desc: Version 12. A reprint featuring corrections to Version 11 and brand-new additions based on recent developments.

characterAbstracts.name: Raven Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: Ravens are known to be the ferrymen of the dead. This bow's limb is decorated with raven feathers, which forebode the imminent death of its target.

materialAbstracts.name: Fragment of Decarabian's Epic
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Andrius once declared war upon Decarabian, but failed to even scratch the capital of the Lord of the Tower. If it were not for the song of freedom that shattered the city in an instant, Decarabian's dream would have gone on forever.

materialAbstracts.name: Debris of Decarabian's City
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Decarabian, the God of Storms, was content with the capital city he had raised, and accepted the worship of the people from atop his tower. But he knew not that the people did not bow to him out of respect or adoration.

materialAbstracts.name: Tile of Decarabian's Tower
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The place now known as Stormterror's Lair was once the capital city of Decarabian, the God of Storms. Since this dream of prosperity was created entirely by his divine might, the broken pieces left behind by the shattering of that dream still possess great power.

materialAbstracts.name: Scattered Piece of Decarabian's Dream
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The people did not bow to Decarabian out of respect or adoration, but because the harsh winds had laid them low. This was the shattered dream and ambition of the Anemo Archon before the rise of Barbatos.
He tried so hard to make his dream come true, and so the fragments of that dream are still mighty.

characterAbstracts.name: Tighnari
characterAbstracts.desc: A young researcher well-versed in botany who currently serves as a Forest Watcher in Avidya Forest. He is a straight shooter with a warm heart - and a dab hand at guiding even the dullest of pupils.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Dendro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Cyno
characterAbstracts.desc: The General Mahamatra in charge of supervising the researchers of the Akademiya. It is said that when he gets down to work, the General Mahamatra is even more efficient than the "Great Vayuvyastra" made by the Kshahrewar.

characterAbstracts.name: Candace
characterAbstracts.desc: A descendant of King Deshret with an amber left eye. The defender of Aaru Village.

characterAbstracts.name: Faruzan
characterAbstracts.desc: A researcher from "one hundred years ago." She enjoys self-identifying as everyone's senior, and has significant knowledge of ancient scripts and machines of all kinds.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Admonition
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Admonition is the branches of the nation of wisdom.

Admonition comes from a pure heart. Only sensible words of goodwill can express profound wisdom and free the sprout of knowledge from the shackles of arrogance.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Admonition
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Admonition is the branches of the nation of wisdom.

Admonition is paired with wise thinking. Careful deliberation affords humble words a clarity that convinces the wise and enlightens the foolish. Such words allow wisdom to flow like an unobstructed river.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Admonition
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Admonition is the branches of the nation of wisdom.

Admonition is completed by good deeds. What is done confers real meaning upon what is said. When one's mind, words, and deeds are aligned, their nourishment shall guarantee the fruition of wisdom's tree.

characterAbstracts.name: Yoimiya
characterAbstracts.desc: Owner of Naganohara Fireworks. Known as "Queen of the Summer Festival," she excels in her craft of creating fireworks that symbolize people's hopes and dreams.

characterAbstracts.name: Thoma
characterAbstracts.desc: The Kamisato Clan's housekeeper. A well-known "fixer" in Inazuma.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Electro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Sangonomiya Kokomi
characterAbstracts.desc: The Divine Priestess of Watatsumi Island. All of the island's affairs are at this young lady's fingertips.

characterAbstracts.name: Shikanoin Heizou
characterAbstracts.desc: A young prodigy detective from the Tenryou Commission. His senses are sharp and his thoughts are clear.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Transience
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Transience is the dream of the nation of thunder.
The fleeting nature of this mortal world is the essence of beauty, for are our lives in this world not akin to the levin flash? Yet the might of the divine comes suddenly, and before the roar of eternity, who can stand?

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Transience
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Transience is the dream of the nation of thunder.
We find the greatest joys in mortal life in transient dreams, for is life itself not like the shadow of the thunder? Pursue your dreams into the clouds if you wish, and enjoy the unexpected silence of the dim lamp-lit nights.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Transience
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Transience is the dream of the nation of thunder.
Fleeting glories are the highest expression of mortal beauty, for are we mortals not like the flashing lightning itself? Like a lovely dream or blossoming spark, we shall leave a gorgeous mark on the eternal night sky.

characterAbstracts.name: Qiqi
characterAbstracts.desc: An apprentice and herb gatherer at Bubu Pharmacy. An undead with a bone-white complexion, she seldom has much in the way of words or emotion.

characterAbstracts.name: Ningguang
characterAbstracts.desc: The Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing. Her wealth is unsurpassed in all of Teyvat.

characterAbstracts.name: Keqing
characterAbstracts.desc: The Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing. Keqing has much to say about Rex Lapis's unilateral approach to policymaking in Liyue — but in truth, gods admire skeptics such as her quite a lot.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Shenhe
characterAbstracts.desc: An adepti disciple with a most unusual air about her. Having spent much time cultivating in isolation in Liyue's mountains, she has become every bit as cool and distant as the adepti themselves.

characterAbstracts.name: Xiao
characterAbstracts.desc: A yaksha adeptus who defends Liyue. Also heralded as the "Conqueror of Demons" and "Vigilant Yaksha."

characterAbstracts.name: Yelan
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious person who claims to work for the Ministry of Civil Affairs, but is a "non-entity" on the Ministry of Civil Affairs' list.

characterAbstracts.name: Gaming
characterAbstracts.desc: Guard of the Sword and Strongbox Secure Transport Agency, and the head of the "Mighty Mythical Beasts" Wushou troupe.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Prosperity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Prosperity is the people's pursuit in the land of Geo.
Prosperity is Liyue's past, present, and future. This prosperity is unmatched and unobtainable by any other nations — it all belongs to Liyue and its inhabitants.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Prosperity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Prosperity is the people's pursuit in the land of Geo.
Prosperity is the promise made by Liyue to its children: To repay the hard-working laborers with enough gold to brighten up this land.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Prosperity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Prosperity is the people's pursuit in the land of Geo.
Prosperity is the blessing of Liyue, it is the foundation of the great city built by the gods and the people of Liyue, and it is the source of the peace and safety of the land.

characterAbstracts.name: Hunter's Path
characterAbstracts.desc: This gilded bow was made using precious white branches. It has felled countless wicked beasts attempting to infiltrate the woods.

characterAbstracts.name: End of the Line
characterAbstracts.desc: This seems to be a now-extinct fish. Its body is sufficiently elastic that a string may be attached to it to let it serve as a bow.

characterAbstracts.name: King's Squire
characterAbstracts.desc: It has taken on the shape of a bow that can shoot the enemies of the forest down.

characterAbstracts.name: Makhaira Aquamarine
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient greatsword that gleams like the waters themselves. A thousand years of sand erosion has not dulled its unnaturally sharp edge one bit.

characterAbstracts.name: Tulaytullah's Remembrance
characterAbstracts.desc: A bell crafted of deep sapphire and sterling silver. Its echoes are as crisp as they are distant.

characterAbstracts.name: Beacon of the Reed Sea
characterAbstracts.desc: A large, flat-tipped sword designed in to fit as the weapon of an ancient king or some ceremonial instrument.

characterAbstracts.name: Scion of the Blazing Sun
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient longbow that is a remnant of King Deshret's ancient era. An indecipherable ancient text and solemn patterns have been carved into it.

materialAbstracts.name: Echo of Scorching Might
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

A long time ago, the people of the Lord of Deserts carved these imperial insignias based on robust beetles to memorialize the bright sun that marked the shifting of day and night, as well as the infinity of such times.

Though the name of that Lord is no longer mentioned, these imperial insignias have been preserved through time, each bearing a faint ambiance of those past glories.

These insignias travel with the descendants of the Eremite Tribe, silently telling the tales of their then-Lord.

materialAbstracts.name: Remnant Glow of Scorching Might
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
To weave together myriad thoughts and reign over countless souls — this is the essence of power.
However, power is not cold-blooded tyranny. Its true ideal, at its heart, is to create a utopia free of worry, schemes, and slavery.
It was just as the silent lord saw in the crystal's secrets, and just as the lost companion had once taught.
The dark insect insignia and the steel judgment thus laid the foundations of the kingdom's rules.

materialAbstracts.name: Dream of Scorching Might
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

Silver moonlight and clear springs once completed the scenery of the oases. But as the Lord of Flowers faded in the darkening sandstorm, so was the worriless golden paradise submerged by death.
In the poetry of the Eremite Tribe, the moon cast its silver light on the crimson mantle, causing Al-Ahmar, the Mourning King, to be driven to madness.
In a melancholic desert ballad, driven by the haunting nostalgia, the lonely king created an ever-youthful dreamland in the center of the desert, where undisturbed water sprang up and perpetual dusk remained.

materialAbstracts.name: Olden Days of Scorching Might
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

In the era when the ignorant Lord of Deserts ruled, his power descended upon every inch of the land like the scorching sun.
Ancient stone tablets record that he turned his power into seven rays of blinding light or seven pillars, which he granted equally and mercifully to everyone. No one was neglected, nor was anyone discontented.
That was a forgotten golden era, an era when the Lord of Flowers had faded into the sands and the Lord of Verdure was determined to leave. Only the descendants in the yellow sand chose to follow their god. Even as the grim shadow of calamity loomed, the power in which they had faith shone brightly like amber and gold.
Yet calamity befell nonetheless, and the golden insectoid insignias were buried beneath the depths of shrine and palace, under collapsed pillars engraved with images of eagles and bulls.

characterAbstracts.name: Gorou
characterAbstracts.desc: The great general of Watatsumi Island's forces. He is deeply trusted by his subordinates.

characterAbstracts.name: Yae Miko
characterAbstracts.desc: Lady Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Also serves as the editor-in-chief of Yae Publishing House. Unimaginable intelligence and cunning are hidden under her beautiful appearance.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Electro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Sayu
characterAbstracts.desc: A pint-sized ninja attached to the Shuumatsuban, who always seems sleep-deprived.

characterAbstracts.name: Raiden Shogun
characterAbstracts.desc: Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, who promised the people of Inazuma an unchanging Eternity.

characterAbstracts.name: Chiori
characterAbstracts.desc: The owner of Chioriya Boutique. A tailor renowned throughout Fontaine.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Light
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Light is the yearning of the land of thunder.
Though they must live forever on the earth, humanity will always reach for the light. Mortals will pursue and surpass, and they will never stop. A sealed eternity may, perhaps, look magnificent, but its essence is death.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Light
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Light is the yearning of the land of thunder.
Though the sun rays themselves should be blocked by layers upon layers of clouds, there are still those in the thunder god's land who dream of piercing that wrathful sea of lightning to pursue the glory of the divine, fearing not that they shall be cruelly struck down.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Light
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Light is the yearning of the land of thunder.
The ruler who claims to have perceived all forever aims to hoard celestial glory. But this vision that cannot be shared only leads people to long for it more fiercely, like moths diving into the flame.

characterAbstracts.name: "The Catch"
characterAbstracts.desc: In the distant past, this was the beloved spear of a famed Inazuman bandit.

characterAbstracts.name: Polar Star
characterAbstracts.desc: A pristine bow that is as sharp as the glaciers of the far north.

characterAbstracts.name: Kitain Cross Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: A special lance that was once used by a famed warrior who guarded the Tatarigami on Yashiori Island.

characterAbstracts.name: Wavebreaker's Fin
characterAbstracts.desc: A naginata forged from luminescent material deep in the ocean depths. It was once the possession of the tengu race.

characterAbstracts.name: Kagura's Verity
characterAbstracts.desc: The bells used when performing the Kagura Dance, blessed by the Guuji herself. The scent of the Sacred Sakura tree lingers on it.

characterAbstracts.name: Engulfing Lightning
characterAbstracts.desc: A naginata used to "cut grass." Any army that stands before this weapon will probably be likewise cut down...

characterAbstracts.name: Kagotsurube Isshin
characterAbstracts.desc: This famed blade was born in a nation to the far north. But in the name of "Isshin," it was stained with many a dark deed on its home-bound journey.

materialAbstracts.name: Mask of the One-Horned
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
In the lost songs of the oni nursemaids, Torachiyo was an elegant young man, strong of body and fair of face. He was once a beloved lieutenant of the Shogun, and he followed her into the dark abyssal realms to repel the defiled ones, winning renown for the oni, whose blood thinned with each passing day.
None now sing these songs, but the mask of a horned oni, even in a different form, still possesses power beyond the norm.

materialAbstracts.name: Mask of the Wicked Lieutenant
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Folktales tell that once upon a time, there lived an oni named Torachiyo. Torachiyo was a highly skilled warrior, such that it was once said the Torachiyo might dance amid a thousand blades, juunihitoe robes becoming shredded like falling violet petals, and yet not receive a single wound. Yet this oni would eventually betray the Shogun and revolt, becoming shorn of an arm and a horn in the battle before fleeing and slaying itself in a fit of furious madness.
Hearsay holds that the stubborn oni often hold fear and distress in their hearts. That they should fantasize about eternity yet fear the moment, and are apt to become swallowed by terror or anger is their just reward. This mask depicts Torachiyo, fangs bared.

materialAbstracts.name: Mask of the Tiger's Bite
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
"Sumirezome Sangetsu Kogetsukan" depicts the fierce oni Torachiyo shattering the Shogun's naginata with a single bite, thus gaining the upper hand for a time. As such, masks that are based on him have finely crafted fangs.
In the denouement of this tale, the wounded oni fled into the forest, deathly afraid of showing himself even to the cold moonlight. The wind that whispers through the alleys and valleys can be said to resemble his quiet cries of agony, and so there is a poetic seasonal expression for this in Inazuma: "Torachiyo's Wind."

materialAbstracts.name: Mask of the Kijin
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Chiyo, a warrior of the oni tribe with the Electro Mitsudomoe emblem emblazoned on her back, was once swallowed whole by a beast from beyond this world that had a tiger's body and a serpent's tail while holding back the forces of darkness. At last, she tore the creature's innards apart from within, breaking free.
This is the origin of the phrase "Chiyo the Tiger-Bite," and would be changed over many years to "Torachiyo."
But within the belly of the beast, she was stained by a deep sin and saw her comrades ripped to shreds by those blood-red teeth. Steeped in darkness as far as the eye could see, she would eventually draw her sword upon the Almighty Narukami Ogosho. Her sword-arm and one horn would be cloven, and she would flee from the city into the forest like a wounded beast. There, they say that she was taken for some unknown monster and slain by the tengu, or perhaps by the Shuumatsuban — or perhaps by a scion of the Iwakura Clan training deep in the mountains, for her features had been twisted by hatred and the agony of her wounds. Or perhaps she even met the oni-masked, sword-bearing doll near the corpse of the giant serpent, and there ended her life's journey.
Few among those who fought against the abyss in those days were spared pitch-dark dreams. Those who slew monsters and then became them were hardly the minority. The border between worlds grows fragile, and corruption of this kind is perhaps not merely monodirectional.

characterAbstracts.name: Mappa Mare
characterAbstracts.desc: A nautical chart featuring nearby currents and climates that somehow found its way into Liyue via foreign traders.

characterAbstracts.name: Lithic Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: A spear forged from the rocks of the Guyun Stone Forest. Its hardness knows no equal.

characterAbstracts.name: Memory of Dust
characterAbstracts.desc: A stone dumbbell containing distant memories. Its endless transformations reveal the power within.

characterAbstracts.name: Staff of Homa
characterAbstracts.desc: A "firewood staff" that was once used in ancient and long-lost rituals.

characterAbstracts.name: Serpent Spine
characterAbstracts.desc: A rare weapon whose origin is the ancient ocean. One can hear the sound of the ageless waves as one swings it.

characterAbstracts.name: Luxurious Sea-Lord
characterAbstracts.desc: The great king of the ocean. Having been air-dried, it makes for a fine weapon as well as emergency sustenance.

characterAbstracts.name: Prototype Archaic
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient greatsword discovered in the Blackcliff Forge. It swings with such an immense force that one feels it could cut straight through reality itself.

characterAbstracts.name: Prototype Starglitter
characterAbstracts.desc: A hooked spear discovered hidden away in the Blackcliff Forge. The glimmers along the sharp edge are like stars in the night.

characterAbstracts.name: Vortex Vanquisher
characterAbstracts.desc: This sharp polearm can seemingly pierce through anything. When swung, one can almost see the rift it tears in the air.

characterAbstracts.name: Compound Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: An exotic metallic bow from a distant land. Though extremely difficult to maintain, it is easy to nock and fires with tremendous force.

characterAbstracts.name: Iron Sting
characterAbstracts.desc: An exotic long-bladed rapier that somehow found its way into Liyue via foreign traders. It is light, agile, and sharp.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyrider Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A reliable steel sword. The legendary Skyrider once tried to ride it as a flying sword... for the second time.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyrider Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A reliable steel sword. The legendary Skyrider once tried to ride it as a flying sword...

characterAbstracts.name: Black Tassel
characterAbstracts.desc: An exceptionally powerful polearm that also offers a simple but elegant solution to the issue of the easily stained white tassel.

characterAbstracts.name: Fading Twilight
characterAbstracts.desc: A precious bow made of platinum, inlaid with an orb that shimmers with the light of eventide.

characterAbstracts.name: Cloudforged
characterAbstracts.desc: A prototype for a standard-issue weapon the Yuheng commissioned from Blackcliff Forge after having analyzed the ancient mechanisms that protected the adeptal abode upon Tianheng.

materialAbstracts.name: Chunk of Aerosiderite
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
When Khaenri'ah was destroyed, a great sinner created endless monsters with dark, alien blood flowing through their veins. They rampaged across the land, destroying all in their paths. They were mutated lifeforms, and the mutations were caused by powers from beyond this world. The black serpentine dragon Durin that attacked Mondstadt was one such mutated being.

materialAbstracts.name: Piece of Aerosiderite
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Rumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat. Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

materialAbstracts.name: Grain of Aerosiderite
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A black meteor once fell beyond Liyue's Sea of Clouds, said to have fallen to vanquish a monster. However, it was stained by powerful tainted blood, so this item no longer possesses the pure power of Rex Lapis.

materialAbstracts.name: Bit of Aerosiderite
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said that many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

characterAbstracts.name: Recurve Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: It is said that this bow can shoot down eagles in flight, but ultimately how true that is depends on the skill of the archer.

characterAbstracts.name: Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds
characterAbstracts.desc: An educational tome written by anonymous early inhabitants who worshiped the wind. It has been blessed by the wind for its faithfulness and influence over the millennia.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyward Spine
characterAbstracts.desc: A polearm that symbolizes Dvalin's firm resolve. The upright shaft of this weapon points towards the heavens, clad in the might of sky and wind.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: An old greatsword that belonged to the erstwhile rulers of Mondstadt. It is made from the finest-quality materials and has stood the test of time. A weapon for use by the nobility only.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: An old longbow that belonged to the erstwhile aristocratic rulers of Mondstadt. Countless generations later, the bowstring is still tight and can still fire arrows with great force.

characterAbstracts.name: Otherworldly Story
characterAbstracts.desc: A cheap fantasy novel with no value whatsoever. Any claim that it possesses the power of catalysis is also pure fantasy.

characterAbstracts.name: Frostbearer
characterAbstracts.desc: A fruit that possesses a strange, frosty will. A faint sense of agony emanates from it.

characterAbstracts.name: Beginner's Protector
characterAbstracts.desc: A polearm as straight as a flag pole. Well suited to most combat situations, it has an imposing presence when swung.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler's Handy Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A handy steel sword which contains scissors, a magnifying glass, tinder, and other useful items in its sheath.

characterAbstracts.name: Alley Hunter
characterAbstracts.desc: An intricate, opulent longbow. It once belonged to a gentleman thief who was never caught.

characterAbstracts.name: Wolf's Gravestone
characterAbstracts.desc: A longsword used by the Wolf Knight. Originally just a heavy sheet of iron given to the knight by a blacksmith from the city, it became endowed with legendary power owing to his friendship with the wolves.

characterAbstracts.name: White Iron Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A claymore made from white iron. Lightweight without compromising on power. Effective even when wielded by one of average strength, it is extremely deadly in the hands of a physically stronger wielder.

characterAbstracts.name: Sacrificial Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A ceremonial sword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

characterAbstracts.name: Sacrificial Fragments
characterAbstracts.desc: A weathered script, the text of which is no longer legible. A cursed item eroded by the winds of time.

characterAbstracts.name: Festering Desire
characterAbstracts.desc: A creepy straight sword that almost seems to yearn for life. It drips with a shriveling venom that could even corrupt a mighty dragon.

characterAbstracts.name: Freedom-Sworn
characterAbstracts.desc: A straight sword, azure as antediluvian song, and as keen as the oaths of freedom taken in the Land of Wind.

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A heavy ceremonial sword of the Knights of Favonius. It channels elemental power easily and is highly destructive.

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Warbow
characterAbstracts.desc: A standard-issue recurve bow of the Knights of Favonius. Only the best archers can unleash its full potential.

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Lance
characterAbstracts.desc: A polearm made in the style of the Knights of Favonius. Its shaft is straight, and its tip flows lightly like the wind.

characterAbstracts.name: Iron Point
characterAbstracts.desc: Sharp and pointy at one end, it is a balanced weapon that is quite popular among travelers.

characterAbstracts.name: Amos' Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: An extremely ancient bow that has retained its power despite its original master being long gone. It draws power from everyone and everything in the world, and the further away you are from that which your heart desires, the more powerful it is.

characterAbstracts.name: Windblume Ode
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow adorned with nameless flowers that bears the earnest hopes of an equally nameless person.

characterAbstracts.name: Mailed Flower
characterAbstracts.desc: A graceful and elegant greatsword that is decorated with flowers and ribbons.

materialAbstracts.name: Fetters of the Dandelion Gladiator
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
It's a human thing to exaggerate a hero's story, even to the point of elevating the fetters that once bound the hero to the level of an enemy of true freedom.
As a result, these fetters were granted extraordinary powers.

materialAbstracts.name: Dream of the Dandelion Gladiator
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Vennessa may have been freed from slavery, but she then found herself subject to many other, even greater forms of bondage. What began as a duty to her tribespeople extended to all of Mondstadt, then to the concept of freedom itself, and beyond a point even to the whole world.
What she really hoped for, in truth, was that the world might grow stronger.

materialAbstracts.name: Chains of the Dandelion Gladiator
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The chains that once bound the great hero Vennessa. In truth, all gladiators would have worn chains in that era, and Vennessa was but one of many.

materialAbstracts.name: Shackles of the Dandelion Gladiator
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Vennessa was not truly bound by her chains. If she had so wished, no ordinary physical constraints forged in Mondstadt could have held her, for the land there yielded no ore of exceptional quality, nor did it possess the divine flame of her ancestral home.
She was only bound by her responsibility to take care of her tribespeople.

characterAbstracts.name: Collei
characterAbstracts.desc: A trainee ranger active in Avidya Forest. Behind her enthusiastic words and actions hides a slightly introverted personality.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Dendro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Nilou
characterAbstracts.desc: The star of the Zubayr Theater. She is full of warmth and innocence, and her dances are lively and elegant.

characterAbstracts.name: Wanderer
characterAbstracts.desc: A wayfaring figure whose identity is a mystery. He dresses like a mountain ascetic, but he certainly does not act the part.

characterAbstracts.name: Dehya
characterAbstracts.desc: A member of the Eremites, a mercenary organization that roams the sands of Sumeru. Valiant and powerful, she enjoys great fame amongst her fellow Eremites.

characterAbstracts.name: Sethos
characterAbstracts.desc: The Temple of Silence's heir. Burdened with secrets, he comes from the sands.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Praxis
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Praxes are the roots of the nation of wisdom.

Praxes stem from an unwavering will. All wisdom is manifested through the unyielding pursuit of goodness. Where goodness is not practiced, ingenuity and eloquence wither.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Praxis
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Praxes are the roots of the nation of wisdom.

Praxes validate words of honesty. Though one speaks and acts out of goodwill, one has not yet obtained wisdom. Wisdom, born from action, is a signet pressed upon honest words.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Praxis
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Praxes are the roots of the nation of wisdom.

Praxes bring forth the fruit of wisdom. Practice grants itself meaning, and it is only by treading a path that unites actions, speech, and thought that the wise may reach perfection.

characterAbstracts.name: Beidou
characterAbstracts.desc: Captain of her crew, The Crux. She's quite an unbound and forthright woman.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Yanfei
characterAbstracts.desc: A well-known legal adviser active in Liyue Harbor. A brilliant young lady in whose veins runs the blood of an illuminated beast.

characterAbstracts.name: Xingqiu
characterAbstracts.desc: A young man carrying a longsword who is frequently seen at book booths. He has a chivalrous heart and yearns for justice and fairness for all.

characterAbstracts.name: Xinyan
characterAbstracts.desc: Liyue's sole rock 'n' roll musician. She rebels against ossified prejudices using her music and passionate singing.

characterAbstracts.name: Zhongli
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious expert contracted by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.

characterAbstracts.name: Baizhu
characterAbstracts.desc: The owner of Bubu Pharmacy, who is rarely seen without the white snake named Changsheng. His medicinal knowledge is encyclopedic, and his personal intrigues subtle.

characterAbstracts.name: Xianyun
characterAbstracts.desc: One of the Mighty and Illuminated Adepti of Jueyun, known as "Cloud Retainer." Expert in all kinds of mechanical contraptions, her heart now turns towards the affairs of the mortal world, through which she walks under the name "Xianyun."

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Gold
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Gold is the symbol of the land of Geo.
Gold is the wealth of Liyue, but Liyue's true wealth is the hearts of its people that shine like gold.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Gold
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Gold is the symbol of the land of Geo.
Gold symbolizes conversion. This is the unspoken understanding between Liyue's mountains, land, city, and people. In Liyue, industriousness is converted into gold, and gold into prosperity.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Gold
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Gold is the symbol of the land of Geo.
Gold is the blood that flows deep within Liyue's veins, the muscle that makes up Liyue's beating heart, and the bones that make Liyue stand proud.

characterAbstracts.name: Moonpiercer
characterAbstracts.desc: It is shaped like a giant arrow and can be used as a spear.

characterAbstracts.name: Fruit of Fulfillment
characterAbstracts.desc: It holds the potential to conquer any crisis.

characterAbstracts.name: Staff of the Scarlet Sands
characterAbstracts.desc: One of a paired set of scepters fashioned from obsidian. Legend has it that these staves grant the right to lead the people of the desert, but no retainer now lives who can verify the proper appearance of these regalia.

characterAbstracts.name: Wandering Evenstar
characterAbstracts.desc: This was originally a device used by researchers to observe and perform calculations on celestial phenomena. It serves as a conduit and catalyst.

characterAbstracts.name: A Thousand Floating Dreams
characterAbstracts.desc: The lamp illuminates the dreams that float up over a thousand nights, and in its emerald-green light flows a song of ancient days.

materialAbstracts.name: Oasis Garden's Reminiscence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

People used to say that the Lord of Flowers was the Lord of Joy and Happiness. Freshwater sprang from her sleeves, and thus was the oasis of blossoming flowers born in the desert. Flowers and grasses followed in her footsteps, and gleaming moonlight cleared the way for her.

In the bitter days when the sky turned its back on the ground, the Lord of Flowers extended her mercy to each and every one of the mortals, letting them regain their happiness and egos, allowing leisure and luxury to resume.

materialAbstracts.name: Oasis Garden's Kindness
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

In the literature buried deep beneath the yellow sands, the Lord of Flowers was the Mistress of Dreams.

She bestowed dreams upon the exiled, the manic, and the foolish.

In those dreams, they were presented with their dearest delights. Burdened by the brutality of reality, they were fascinated by the charm of the Lord of Flowers and captivated by her beauty and care.

materialAbstracts.name: Oasis Garden's Mourning
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

The Lord of Flowers was in an amicable relationship with the Jinn.

The Mistress of Flowers and Oases joined hands with the Lord of Deserts and built Ay-Khanoum, the "City of Amphitheaters," which carried the meaning of "City of the Moon Maiden" in the ancient language on the Jinn.

Later, however, it was said that the Lord of Flowers died due to the malice of the burning sun and yellow sand, after which the blossoms of purple Padisarahs were never seen again in the oases. After the departure of the Lord of Flowers, the sandstorms keened, the Jinn sobbed, and the moonlight-silver gem disc lost its original, glad purpose, giving off a mournful glimmer.

materialAbstracts.name: Oasis Garden's Truth
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

"Who would worship a departed god?"

The Lord of Flowers was once in alliance with two other gods. Apart from wisdom and power, she also brought mercy and joy to her people.

Just as the earth needs more than the burning sunshine and pouring rain, to the people of the Lord of Flowers, joy and love, singing and music, and wine and extravagance were just as vital as strength and sensibility.

It is said that flowers blossom so that they may enjoy a spectacular death, and that death was precisely the wholehearted pursuit of the Lord of Flowers - for death adds bitterness to lost joy, and intensifies with time across endless memories.

The ignorant Lord of Deserts was never aware of her reasoning. He only reveled in her immense charm and grace - and as misguided as such fervent affections might be, they were well within the calculations of the Lord of Flowers.

characterAbstracts.name: Predator
characterAbstracts.desc: A uniquely-designed bow. This should not belong in this world.

characterAbstracts.name: Mouun's Moon
characterAbstracts.desc: A lovely warbow made from seashells and coral. A mournful brilliance flows along its moonlight-colored arms.

characterAbstracts.name: Katsuragikiri Nagamasa
characterAbstracts.desc: A blade that was once made in Tatarasuna. Heavy and tough.

characterAbstracts.name: Haran Geppaku Futsu
characterAbstracts.desc: A famed work by the Futsu line of smiths. The name "Haran" comes from the manner in which it resembles the violent, roiling waves.

characterAbstracts.name: Hamayumi
characterAbstracts.desc: A certain shrine maiden once owned this warbow. It was made with surpassing skill, and is both intricate and sturdy.

characterAbstracts.name: Redhorn Stonethresher
characterAbstracts.desc: According to its previous owner, this weapon is the "Mighty Redhorn Stoic Stonethreshing Gilded Goldcrushing Lion Lord" that can send any monster packing with its tail between its legs.

characterAbstracts.name: Thundering Pulse
characterAbstracts.desc: A longbow that was a gift from the Shogun. Eternal lightning crackles all around it.

characterAbstracts.name: Toukabou Shigure
characterAbstracts.desc: A rather special oil-paper umbrella. While long wanderings may make one used to the wind and the rain, there might be some fun in admiring a rainy scene beneath this parasol.

materialAbstracts.name: Narukami's Affection
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
All demons who wander in the wilderness or live amongst mortals will be attracted by the sight of the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, represented by the Electro Mitsudomoe. Though their lives may be longer than any creature, they will at last come to their end. If those with limited lifespans hanker after eternity, then they can only pray that "Eternity" remembers them. And she did indeed answer their prayers, remembering them all, friend and foe alike, in her heart. No matter whether it was the demon owls who resided amidst the fog and ripped through the skies, the bake-danuki who dared to trespass her imperial gardens, or that female oni, lovely as the moon and mighty in battle, yet who would eventually come to blows with her... Whether it was the tengu who soared on dark wings or the Kitsune Saiguu who once walked by her side, but who eventually disappeared forever...
These countless tales have come to rest within her heart, and someday, they will surely shine again in the eternal paradise of her dreams.

materialAbstracts.name: Narukami's Valor
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The treasure of the lord of thunder is her majesty, and that majesty is embodied in her valor and wrath. Her wrath comes from the love that persists in her heart, and her valor supports that anger. Thus, whomsoever should block the path towards eternity or lay a finger on Inazuma's people shall become her foe.
They say that there were four great spirits, three divine foxes, and two great swords — but that the symbol of Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, could only be a single strike, unsurpassed and brilliant as a meteor.

materialAbstracts.name: Narukami's Wisdom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
In the past, the ancients would climb the peak now known as Mt. Yougou and bend wood that had been charred by lightning into a hook to offer as an effigy unto the thundering force that lit up the skies and shook the earth. This shape would eventually become the "Electro Mitsudomoe" symbol, symbolizing the favor, wisdom, and might of Electro, and also the people who represent these values.

materialAbstracts.name: Narukami's Joy
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Those who belong to the Shogunate Commissions are those who administer and exercise power. In the monster-filled tales of the ancient past, those who were deeply trusted by the Shogun would bear talismans with this hooked design on their person, and just as the word "commission" means to "joyfully serve" in the old tongue, those who received her favor would return it with love and loyalty. Yet, after a certain point in time, nothing would be as it was before.

characterAbstracts.name: Debate Club
characterAbstracts.desc: A handy club made of fine steel. The most persuasive line of reasoning in any debater's arsenal.

characterAbstracts.name: Messenger
characterAbstracts.desc: A basic wooden bow. It is said to have once been used as a tool for long-distance communication.

characterAbstracts.name: Dragon's Bane
characterAbstracts.desc: A polearm decorated with an entwining golden dragon. Light and sharp, this weapon may very well kill dragons with ease.

characterAbstracts.name: Fillet Blade
characterAbstracts.desc: A sharp filleting knife. The blade is long, thin, and incredibly sharp.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: This polearm was once cherished by a member of the old nobility that governed Mondstadt long ago. Although it has never seen the light of day, it is still incomparably sharp.

characterAbstracts.name: Calamity Queller
characterAbstracts.desc: A keenly honed weapon forged from some strange crystal. Its faint blue light seems to whisper of countless matters now past.

characterAbstracts.name: The Unforged
characterAbstracts.desc: Capable of driving away evil spirits and wicked people alike, this edgeless claymore seems to possess divine might.

characterAbstracts.name: Eye of Perception
characterAbstracts.desc: A dim black glaze pearl that is said to have the power to read the purity of one's heart.

characterAbstracts.name: Twin Nephrite
characterAbstracts.desc: A jade pendant formed by piecing together two jade stones.

characterAbstracts.name: Primordial Jade Cutter
characterAbstracts.desc: A ceremonial sword masterfully carved from pure jade. There almost seems to be an audible sigh in the wind as it is swung.

characterAbstracts.name: Prototype Rancour
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient longsword discovered in the Blackcliff Forge that cuts through rocks like a hot knife through butter.

characterAbstracts.name: Prototype Crescent
characterAbstracts.desc: A prototype longbow discovered in the Blackcliff Forge. The arrow fired from this bow glimmers like a ray of moonlight.

characterAbstracts.name: Prototype Amber
characterAbstracts.desc: A dully gilded catalyst secretly guarded in the Blackcliff Forge. It seems to glow with the very light from the sky.

characterAbstracts.name: Halberd
characterAbstracts.desc: A polearm with an axe blade mounted on top that can deal quite a lot of damage. It's favored by the Millelith officers.

characterAbstracts.name: Rainslasher
characterAbstracts.desc: A fluorescent greatsword with no sharp edge that crushes enemies with brute force and raw power.

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Pole
characterAbstracts.desc: A weapon made of blackcliff and aerosiderite. There is a dark crimson glow on its cold black sheen.

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Slasher
characterAbstracts.desc: An extremely sturdy greatsword from the Blackcliff Forge. It has a dark crimson color from the blade to pommel.

materialAbstracts.name: Mist Veiled Mercury Elixir
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
With Fulu (Sigils), the adepti can store their power in the form of symbols, and with Waijing (Sub-Space Creation) they can fashion a cosmic paradise with the power of their minds. The manufacture of elixirs, however, has always been shrouded in mystery, for certain death follows for any who swallow them.

materialAbstracts.name: Mist Veiled Primo Elixir
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
An elixir of the highest quality. It embodies a state of intertwining order and chaos, and is said to mirror how the world was when it was first created. Of course, a certain someone knows that this was not the case.

materialAbstracts.name: Mist Veiled Gold Elixir
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Elixirs are in fact pills made from metal alloys. They were created by the adepti, and are able to grant weapons transcendent powers. However, they are rarely seen in the world due to the hubris of the practitioners of martial arts, who prized the ways of combat over the paths of the adepti.

materialAbstracts.name: Mist Veiled Lead Elixir
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Jueyun Karst is the realm of the mighty and illuminated adepti. But other than the ability to control the elements of the world, Jueyun Karst is also home to three other untold secrets: Alchemy, Sigils, and Sub-Space Creation.

characterAbstracts.name: Old Merc's Pal
characterAbstracts.desc: A battle-tested greatsword that has seen better days and worse.

characterAbstracts.name: Deathmatch
characterAbstracts.desc: A sharp crimson polearm that was once a gladiator's priceless treasure. Its awl has been stained by the blood of countless beasts and men.

characterAbstracts.name: Seasoned Hunter's Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow that has been well-polished by time and meticulously cared for by its owner. It feels almost like an extension of the archer's arm.

characterAbstracts.name: Dodoco Tales
characterAbstracts.desc:
A children's book filled with childish short stories at which one cannot help but laugh.
Even those readers who have long reached adulthood cannot help but be absorbed by the innocent, naive little adventures portrayed within.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyward Pride
characterAbstracts.desc: A claymore that symbolizes the pride of Dvalin soaring through the skies. When swung, it emits a deep hum as the full force of Dvalin's command of the sky and the wind is unleashed.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyward Blade
characterAbstracts.desc: The sword of a knight that symbolizes the restored honor of Dvalin. The blessings of the Anemo Archon rest on the fuller of the blade, imbuing the sword with the powers of the sky and the wind.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyward Atlas
characterAbstracts.desc: A cloud atlas symbolizing Dvalin and his former master, the Anemo Archon. It details the winds and clouds of the northern regions and contains the powers of the sky and wind.

characterAbstracts.name: Skyward Harp
characterAbstracts.desc: A greatbow that symbolizes Dvalin's affiliation with the Anemo Archon. The sound of the bow firing is music to the Anemo Archon's ears. It contains the power of the sky and wind within.

characterAbstracts.name: Wine and Song
characterAbstracts.desc: A songbook from the bygone aristocratic era, whose composer has become forgotten. It chronicles the tale of a certain heroic outlaw.

characterAbstracts.name: Bloodtainted Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A steel sword that is said to have been coated with dragon blood, rendering it invulnerable to damage. This effect is not extended to its wielder, however.

characterAbstracts.name: The Widsith
characterAbstracts.desc: A heavy notebook filled with musical scores. Though suffering from moth damage and heavy wear-and-tear, there is still much power to be found among the hand-written words within.

characterAbstracts.name: Hunter's Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: A hunter's music consists of but two sounds: the twang of the bowstring and the whoosh of soaring arrows.

characterAbstracts.name: Sharpshooter's Oath
characterAbstracts.desc: This superior bow once belonged to a master archer. However, it gives off a strong scent, thus making it unsuitable for hunting.

characterAbstracts.name: Sacrificial Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A ceremonial greatsword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

characterAbstracts.name: Sacrificial Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: A ceremonial hunting bow that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

characterAbstracts.name: The Flute
characterAbstracts.desc: Beneath its rusty exterior is a lavishly decorated thin blade. It swings as swiftly as the wind.

characterAbstracts.name: Elegy for the End
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow as lovely as any bard's lyre, its arrows pierce the heart like a lamenting sigh.

characterAbstracts.name: Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers
characterAbstracts.desc: A fictional story of a band of five heroes who go off on a dragon hunt. It is poorly written and structurally incoherent. Its value lies in the many lessons that can be learned from failure.

characterAbstracts.name: Waster Greatsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A sturdy sheet of iron that may be powerful enough to break apart mountains if wielded with enough willpower.

characterAbstracts.name: Sword of Descension
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword of unique craftsmanship. It does not appear to belong to this world.

characterAbstracts.name: Harbinger of Dawn
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword that once shone like the sun. The wielder of this sword will be blessed with a "feel-good" buff. The reflective material on the blade has long worn off.

characterAbstracts.name: The Black Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A pitch-black longsword that thirsts for violence and conflict. It is said that this weapon can cause its user to become drunk on the red wine of slaughter.

characterAbstracts.name: Dragonspine Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: A spear created from the fang of a dragon. It is oddly warm to the touch.

characterAbstracts.name: Missive Windspear
characterAbstracts.desc: A beacon that shows the direction of the wind. Not every idyll carried on the breeze remains a gentle thing...

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Milk Tooth
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Andrius' wolf pack is its blessed honor guard, and even the milk teeth of a wolf cub possess great potential.
In the past, the gods had the responsibility to love all people. Andrius was therefore quite unusual in that he became leader of the wolves, while only welcoming abandoned babies and wanderers when it came to humans.

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Nostalgia
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The Wolf King, believing himself to despise humans, thought himself unable to envision a happy life for humanity, making him unworthy of becoming the Lord of the Winds of the world. Therefore, he chose to disappear. Yet, in truth, he gazes on the ones abandoned by the world ever so gently.

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Broken Fang
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The wolf pack also understands that humans are not solitary creatures. The honorary broken tooth is a parting gift said to bring protection and luck.
In the legends of a far-off world, a female wolf once adopted two great humans. Their home was known as the Cave of Wolves, or Lupercal - that word meaning the same thing as Lupical does in this world.

materialAbstracts.name: Boreal Wolf's Cracked Tooth
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The life of a wolf is not without violence; broken bones or cracked teeth are nothing special.
Andrius found humans to be a disappointment, but believed babies to be innocent. If both the wolf pack and the adopted children chose each other, then they become a Lupical, a fated family.

characterAbstracts.name: Dori
characterAbstracts.desc: An elusive merchant who has a fondness for glittering Mora.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Dendro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Nahida
characterAbstracts.desc: A caged bird secluded within the confines of the Sanctuary of Surasthana who can only see the world in her dreams.

characterAbstracts.name: Layla
characterAbstracts.desc: A Rtawahist student who specializes in Theoretical Astrology. Heavily prone to somnambulism and locked in a grinding war with sleep deprivation, the problem of restful slumber is a most troubling one to her.

characterAbstracts.name: Alhaitham
characterAbstracts.desc: The current scribe of the Sumeru Akademiya, a man endowed with extraordinary intelligence and talent. He lives free — free from the searching eyes of ordinary people, anyway.

characterAbstracts.name: Kaveh
characterAbstracts.desc: A renowned architect from Sumeru who perhaps cares a bit too much about too many things. He is an aesthete troubled by reality.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Ingenuity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
