Ingenuity is the leaf-veins of the nation of wisdom.

Ingenuity springs forth from benevolent consideration. They say that "a poisonous tree bears no kind fruit." Similarly, ingenious nascent ideas are always born from determined and benign minds, for only they are worthy bearers of wisdom.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Ingenuity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Ingenuity is the leaf-veins of the nation of wisdom. Ingenuity sets words of integrity on the right path. One who thinks out of goodwill and in a clever and careful fashion never deviates from the path of boons. Yet one who thinks with contempt and malice shall taint their words with despicable colors.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Ingenuity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Ingenuity is the leaf-veins of the nation of wisdom.

Ingenuity is completed by harmonious conduct. What is done completes what is thought.

Wisdom blooms where the mind, words, and practice converge.

characterAbstracts.name: Kujou Sara
characterAbstracts.desc: A general of the Tenryou Commission. Bold, decisive, and skilled in battle.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Electro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Kamisato Ayato
characterAbstracts.desc: The young but highly accomplished head of the Yashiro Commission's Kamisato Clan. Cultured and polite, he is a man of many ways and means.

characterAbstracts.name: Kamisato Ayaka
characterAbstracts.desc: Daughter of the Yashiro Commission's Kamisato Clan. Dignified and elegant, as well as wise and strong.

characterAbstracts.name: Arataki Itto
characterAbstracts.desc: The first and greatest head of the Arataki Gang, famed throughout Inazuma City's Hanamizaka... Wait, what? You've never heard of them? Are you trying to be funny here?

characterAbstracts.name: Kuki Shinobu
characterAbstracts.desc: The capable and reliable deputy leader of the "Arataki Gang." Please note: capable and reliable are not appellations for the "Arataki Gang," but for their deputy leader in specific.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Elegance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Elegance is the form of the nation of thunder.
Elegance abhors vulgarity, and the elegant ever walk alone. Resisting base evils, unmoved by base loves, never taking refuge in base ignorance — that is how one perceives the chasm between the elegant and the contemptuous.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Elegance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Elegance is the form of the nation of thunder.
Elegance shuns arrogance. The elegant are ever humble, and only by discarding vanity and sloth may one see clearly — and is there not beauty and loveliness even in the basest of appearances?

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Elegance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Elegance is the form of the nation of thunder.
Elegance brooks no flattery, and the elegant are ever noble. They are like the sea eagles who soar on high to contend with the resounding storms. They will not cater to philistine vulgarity, as one would not cast a flower crown into the mud, staining its dignity.

characterAbstracts.name: Yun Jin
characterAbstracts.desc: A renowned Liyue opera singer who is skilled in both playwriting and singing. Her style is one-of-a-kind, exquisite and delicate, much like the person herself.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Kaedehara Kazuha
characterAbstracts.desc: A wandering samurai from Inazuma who is currently with Liyue's Crux Fleet. A gentle and carefree soul whose heart hides a great many burdens from the past.

characterAbstracts.name: Ganyu
characterAbstracts.desc: The secretary at Yuehai Pavilion. The blood of the qilin, an illuminated beast, flows within her veins.

characterAbstracts.name: Hu Tao
characterAbstracts.desc: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

characterAbstracts.name: Chongyun
characterAbstracts.desc: A young exorcist from a family of exorcists. He does everything he can to suppress his abundance of yang energy.

characterAbstracts.name: Xiangling
characterAbstracts.desc: A renowned chef from Liyue. She's extremely passionate about cooking and excels at making her signature hot and spicy dishes.

characterAbstracts.name: Yaoyao
characterAbstracts.desc: Streetward Rambler's youngest disciple. A gentle and caring "little adult."

characterAbstracts.name: Lan Yan
characterAbstracts.desc: A rattan weaver from Chenyu Vale. Clear-minded and well-tempered, she is as lively as a mountain spring.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Diligence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Industriousness is the foundation of the land of Geo.
Industriousness is believing in one's own ability to earn a place in the land of the gods through sweat, wisdom, and power.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Diligence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Industriousness is the foundation of the land of Geo.
Industriousness is the catalyst that flows in the blood of the people of Liyue, able to turn rocks into gold. It is what lies behind the greatness of its great commercial port.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Diligence
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Industriousness is the foundation of the land of Geo.
Diligence is having the bravery and the strength to conquer mountains and seas and to pursue gold and prosperity through honest, hard work.

characterAbstracts.name: Sapwood Blade
characterAbstracts.desc: It has taken on the shape of a blade that can cut down the foes of the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Forest Regalia
characterAbstracts.desc: It has taken on the shape of a greatsword that shall cut down the foes of the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Key of Khaj-Nisut
characterAbstracts.desc: One of a paired set of scepters fashioned from obsidian. They say that this can be used as a key to open the gate to a paradise that lies at the end of the ocean of sand.

characterAbstracts.name: Xiphos' Moonlight
characterAbstracts.desc: This ancient double-edged sword glimmers with moonlight. It is said that a now-silent Jinni dwells within it.

characterAbstracts.name: Light of Foliar Incision
characterAbstracts.desc: The gilded blade was made using precious white branches. It was once used to destroy countless poisons that infested the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Ibis Piercer
characterAbstracts.desc: A golden bow forged from the description in the story. If you use it as a normal weapon, you can also view it as a part of a fictional world that has made it off the pages.

characterAbstracts.name: Dialogues of the Desert Sages
characterAbstracts.desc: A caduceus symbolizing the glory of alchemy, made from special alloys to match its special status. It is exceedingly rigid and heavy, and would probably hurt pretty bad if used as a cudgel.

materialAbstracts.name: Copper Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

Under the instructions of the First Sage, the ancestors of the forest people made these talismans using withered trees to commemorate the Lord of Verdure.

The talisman's shape was inspired by the forest dew. It symbolizes the permeation of wisdom into mortal minds.

materialAbstracts.name: Iron Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

Later, the Lord of Verdure taught people the mystery of the forging of black iron. The innocent mortals thus grasped the knowledge of using fire to forge blades.

The Lord of Verdure took pleasure in their knowledge - Lethal as fire and blades were to her, they made ordinary people powerful.

materialAbstracts.name: Silver Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

In the myriad lore of the forest, the one in the striped cape that resembled blazing flames was the Greater Lord of the Labyrinths and the Owner of the Moon-Mirrored Spring.

When he bowed his head and struck up a friendship with the Lord of Verdure, the tokens of their friendship were the gems that glimmered like water and silver that gleamed like the moonlight.

To repay such a gesture, the Lord of Verdure promised to keep secrets for the Greater Lord of the Labyrinths and safeguard the intricate and beautiful dreams of the rainforest.

No one could have foretold that the magnificent mansion of secrets and dreams would later fade away amidst the shroud of the dark flame of oblivion, after which its ash returned to the soil and became nutrients for the virgin rainforests.

materialAbstracts.name: Golden Talisman of the Forest Dew
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.

"Mortals hold dear three things only: the spring water that embraces the moonlight, verdant life, and ageless youth..."

The nature of "wisdom" is not domination over all minds or scheming to gain all the benefit.

Instead, it is about empowering even ordinary beings to one day overcome their imposed constraints.

Though the roar of the tiger is no longer heard in the forest and the resilient guardians would seclude themselves within the dreams of children... On the night when every secret golden seal is lifted and all dreams glow like amber in the moonlight, perhaps she and her beloved people will eventually win genuine freedom.

characterAbstracts.name: Everlasting Moonglow
characterAbstracts.desc: A string of lovely jasper from the deep sea. It shines with a pure radiance like that of the moon, and just as ever-distant.

characterAbstracts.name: Amenoma Kageuchi
characterAbstracts.desc: A blade custom made for a famed samurai who could strike down a tengu warrior, known for their incredible agility, in midair.

characterAbstracts.name: Akuoumaru
characterAbstracts.desc: The beloved sword of the legendary "Akuou." The blade is huge and majestic, but is surprisingly easy to wield.

characterAbstracts.name: Hakushin Ring
characterAbstracts.desc: A catalyst that carries the memory of the Kitsune Saiguu of ancient times. However, this device is but an impoverished vessel for the full breadth of her thought.

characterAbstracts.name: Oathsworn Eye
characterAbstracts.desc: A national treasure of Byakuyakoku stored in the Dainichi Mikoshi. With the coming of the Serpent God, this item was used to notarize great oaths and wishes.

characterAbstracts.name: Mistsplitter Reforged
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword that blazes with a fierce violet light. The name "Reforged" comes from it having been broken once before.

materialAbstracts.name: Jeweled Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
This coral cannot be found anywhere in Teyvat, but was a gift that the great serpent obtained when it broke into the Dark Sea. For that abyssal snake, to be filled with coral was to be mighty, and its power would be shaved away as those corals were lost. In other words, those corals contain power far beyond the norm.

materialAbstracts.name: Jade Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Fleeing into the Dark Sea, the god that had lost everything met the abandoned people who had nothing within the ocean depths. Thus it elected to remain and become their "Orobashi no Mikoto," their "Watatsumi Omikami."
It is said that the great snake god once broke off all the coral branches on its body to give light to the children who were curled up in the darkness. They also say that it used these coral branches to create a huge ladder to allow those children to once again reach the surface and see the light of day.

materialAbstracts.name: Coral Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Watatsumi Island is the furthest from Narukami Island in the Inazuman island chain, and its name means "the god of the oceans" in the island's ancient tongue. Legend has it that when the great serpent first arose within the abyssal nation of ever-night, its fluorescent body was covered in myriad-colored coral.

materialAbstracts.name: Golden Branch of a Distant Sea
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The meaning that lies behind the name "Watatsumi" is simply the unrequited hopes that the abandoned people who dwelt in the deep sea pinned upon the serpent god that led them.
And it was also because the serpent god now had people who worshiped it that it stayed in the world it should have long fled, breaking off the coral branches that adorned its body, treading upon land where it should not have, and facing a foe it could never hope to match — till at last, its divine form was sundered along with the mountains, its ichor turned into plasma, and its will and power became a curse that could never be extinguished: Tatarigami.

characterAbstracts.name: Solar Pearl
characterAbstracts.desc: A dull, golden pearl made of an unknown substance that harbors the light of the sun and the moon and pulses with a warm strength.

characterAbstracts.name: Lion's Roar
characterAbstracts.desc: A sharp blade with extravagant carvings that somehow does not compromise on durability and sharpness. It roars like a lion as it cuts through the air.

characterAbstracts.name: Lithic Blade
characterAbstracts.desc: A greatsword carved and chiseled from the very bedrock of Liyue.

characterAbstracts.name: Primordial Jade Winged-Spear
characterAbstracts.desc: A jade polearm made by the archons, capable of slaying ancient beasts.

characterAbstracts.name: Rust
characterAbstracts.desc: A completely rusted iron greatbow. The average person would lack the strength to even lift it, let alone fire it.

characterAbstracts.name: Slingshot
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow, despite the name. After countless experiments and improvements to the design, the creator of the ultimate slingshot found himself to have made what was actually a bow.

characterAbstracts.name: Summit Shaper
characterAbstracts.desc: A symbol of a legendary pact, this sharp blade once cut off the peak of a mountain.

characterAbstracts.name: Dark Iron Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A perfectly ordinary iron sword, just slightly darker than most.

characterAbstracts.name: Crescent Pike
characterAbstracts.desc: An exotic weapon with an extremely long blade on the top and a crescent blade at the bottom. It found its way into Liyue through foreign traders. With practice, it can deal heavy damage.

characterAbstracts.name: Whiteblind
characterAbstracts.desc: An exotic sword with one section of the blade left blunt. It made its way into Liyue via the hands of foreign traders. Incredibly powerful in the hands of someone who knows how to use it.

characterAbstracts.name: White Tassel
characterAbstracts.desc: A standard-issue weapon of the Millelith soldiers. It has a sturdy shaft and sharp spearhead. It's a reliable weapon.

characterAbstracts.name: Emerald Orb
characterAbstracts.desc: A catalyst carved out of the hard jade from Jueyun Karst north of Liyue. Small, light, and durable, it is known more colloquially as the "jade ball."

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Warbow
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow made of blackcliff that features extremely sturdy bow limbs. It requires an archer with a strong bow arm to use.

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Agate
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious catalyst made of a material known as "blackcliff." It has an ominous crimson glow that seems to pulse in synchronization with the tremors from deep within the earth.

characterAbstracts.name: Blackcliff Longsword
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword made of a material known as "blackcliff." It has a dark crimson glow on its black blade.

characterAbstracts.name: Aqua Simulacra
characterAbstracts.desc: This longbow's color is unpredictable. Under the light, it takes on a lustrous, watery blue.

characterAbstracts.name: Jadefall's Splendor
characterAbstracts.desc: A ritual vessel carved from jade that reflects the luster of the skies and the clear waters.

characterAbstracts.name: Sacrificial Jade
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient jade pendant that gleams like clear water. It seems to have been used in ancient ceremonies.

materialAbstracts.name: Luminous Sands from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The stone pillars that tower amid Guyun Stone Forest were once the stone spears Morax used to defeat his enemies. Over time, the gods' substance has seeped into the pillars that pin them down, lending them divine power. The pillars sometimes shed fragments of hatred and curses.

materialAbstracts.name: Relic from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The stone spear has a glimmering core formed by the power of the defeated gods. Their hatred is not directed at Morax, however, for they have lost themselves a long time ago and are incapable of holding personal grudges.

materialAbstracts.name: Divine Body from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
That which lurks within and animates this relic are the divine remains of lamenting gods. They are unrealized ideals, designs for a prosperous humanity that could never be. They may now lie deep within stone and sea, but they will not go quietly into the night.

materialAbstracts.name: Lustrous Stone from Guyun
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The learned know that Guyun Stone Forest is far more than simply a miraculous sight on the sea to behold: It is the cemetery of the former gods of Liyue. Hatred and filth have periodically risen up from it, but all have been subdued by a demon-conquering young man.

characterAbstracts.name: Cool Steel
characterAbstracts.desc: A reliable steel-forged weapon that serves as a testament to the great adventures of its old master.

characterAbstracts.name: Pocket Grimoire
characterAbstracts.desc: A carefully compiled notebook featuring the essentials needed to pass a magic exam.

characterAbstracts.name: Apprentice's Notes
characterAbstracts.desc: Notes left behind by a top student. Many useful spells are listed, and the handwriting is beautiful.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Grimoire
characterAbstracts.desc: A book that once belonged to a court mage of Mondstadt who served the nobility. It contains faithful and comprehensive historical accounts as well as magic spells.

characterAbstracts.name: Royal Longsword
characterAbstracts.desc: An old longsword that belonged to the erstwhile rulers of Mondstadt. Exquisitely crafted, the carvings and embellishments testify to the stature of its owner.

characterAbstracts.name: Mitternachts Waltz
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow painted the color of transgression and nights of illusion.

characterAbstracts.name: The Alley Flash
characterAbstracts.desc: A straight sword as black as the night. It once belonged to a thief who roamed the benighted streets.

characterAbstracts.name: Song of Broken Pines
characterAbstracts.desc: A greatsword as light as the sigh of grass in the breeze, yet as merciless to the corrupt as a typhoon.

characterAbstracts.name: The Stringless
characterAbstracts.desc: A bow that once served as an extraordinary instrument. It is no longer capable of getting people up and dancing.

characterAbstracts.name: The Viridescent Hunt
characterAbstracts.desc: A pure green hunting bow. This once belonged to a certain hunter whose home was the forest.

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A standard-issue longsword of the Knights of Favonius. When you're armed with this agile and sharp weapon, channeling the power of the elements has never been so easy!

characterAbstracts.name: Favonius Codex
characterAbstracts.desc: A secret tome that belonged to the scholars of the Knights of Favonius. It describes the logic and power of elements and matter.

characterAbstracts.name: Cinnabar Spindle
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword made from materials that do not belong in this world. The power within might even be able to withstand the corruption of a venom that could corrode a mighty dragon.

characterAbstracts.name: The Bell
characterAbstracts.desc: A heavy greatsword. A clock is embedded within it, though its internal mechanisms have long been damaged.

characterAbstracts.name: Ferrous Shadow
characterAbstracts.desc: A replica of the famed sword of Arundolyn, the Lion of Light. Feel the power of a legendary hero as you hold this sword in your hand! Imagine yourself as the great warrior himself! Note: Daydreaming not recommended in live combat.

characterAbstracts.name: Silver Sword
characterAbstracts.desc: A sword for exorcising demons. Everyone knows it's made of a silver alloy, not pure silver.

characterAbstracts.name: Snow-Tombed Starsilver
characterAbstracts.desc: An ancient greatsword that was stored between frescoes. Forged from Starsilver, it has the power to cleave through ice and snow.

characterAbstracts.name: Aquila Favonia
characterAbstracts.desc: The soul of the Knights of Favonius. Millennia later, it still calls on the winds of swift justice to vanquish all evil — just like the last heroine who wielded it.

characterAbstracts.name: Magic Guide
characterAbstracts.desc: Version 12. A reprint featuring corrections to Version 11 and brand-new additions based on recent developments.

characterAbstracts.name: Raven Bow
characterAbstracts.desc: Ravens are known to be the ferrymen of the dead. This bow's limb is decorated with raven feathers, which forebode the imminent death of its target.

characterAbstracts.name: Wolf-Fang
characterAbstracts.desc: Legend has it that this longsword was once used by a wandering knight in the distant past.

materialAbstracts.name: Fragment of Decarabian's Epic
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Andrius once declared war upon Decarabian, but failed to even scratch the capital of the Lord of the Tower. If it were not for the song of freedom that shattered the city in an instant, Decarabian's dream would have gone on forever.

materialAbstracts.name: Debris of Decarabian's City
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Decarabian, the God of Storms, was content with the capital city he had raised, and accepted the worship of the people from atop his tower. But he knew not that the people did not bow to him out of respect or adoration.

materialAbstracts.name: Tile of Decarabian's Tower
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The place now known as Stormterror's Lair was once the capital city of Decarabian, the God of Storms. Since this dream of prosperity was created entirely by his divine might, the broken pieces left behind by the shattering of that dream still possess great power.

materialAbstracts.name: Scattered Piece of Decarabian's Dream
materialAbstracts.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The people did not bow to Decarabian out of respect or adoration, but because the harsh winds had laid them low. This was the shattered dream and ambition of the Anemo Archon before the rise of Barbatos.
He tried so hard to make his dream come true, and so the fragments of that dream are still mighty.

characterAbstracts.name: Tighnari
characterAbstracts.desc: A young researcher well-versed in botany who currently serves as a Forest Watcher in Avidya Forest. He is a straight shooter with a warm heart - and a dab hand at guiding even the dullest of pupils.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Dendro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Cyno
characterAbstracts.desc: The General Mahamatra in charge of supervising the researchers of the Akademiya. It is said that when he gets down to work, the General Mahamatra is even more efficient than the "Great Vayuvyastra" made by the Kshahrewar.

characterAbstracts.name: Candace
characterAbstracts.desc: A descendant of King Deshret with an amber left eye. The defender of Aaru Village.

characterAbstracts.name: Faruzan
characterAbstracts.desc: A researcher from "one hundred years ago." She enjoys self-identifying as everyone's senior, and has significant knowledge of ancient scripts and machines of all kinds.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Admonition
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Admonition is the branches of the nation of wisdom.

Admonition comes from a pure heart. Only sensible words of goodwill can express profound wisdom and free the sprout of knowledge from the shackles of arrogance.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Admonition
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Admonition is the branches of the nation of wisdom.

Admonition is paired with wise thinking. Careful deliberation affords humble words a clarity that convinces the wise and enlightens the foolish. Such words allow wisdom to flow like an unobstructed river.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Admonition
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.

Admonition is the branches of the nation of wisdom.

Admonition is completed by good deeds. What is done confers real meaning upon what is said. When one's mind, words, and deeds are aligned, their nourishment shall guarantee the fruition of wisdom's tree.

characterAbstracts.name: Yoimiya
characterAbstracts.desc: Owner of Naganohara Fireworks. Known as "Queen of the Summer Festival," she excels in her craft of creating fireworks that symbolize people's hopes and dreams.

characterAbstracts.name: Thoma
characterAbstracts.desc: The Kamisato Clan's housekeeper. A well-known "fixer" in Inazuma.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Electro)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Sangonomiya Kokomi
characterAbstracts.desc: The Divine Priestess of Watatsumi Island. All of the island's affairs are at this young lady's fingertips.

characterAbstracts.name: Shikanoin Heizou
characterAbstracts.desc: A young prodigy detective from the Tenryou Commission. His senses are sharp and his thoughts are clear.

characterAbstracts.name: Kirara
characterAbstracts.desc: A courier for Komaniya Express, a delivery company in Inazuma. A nekomata who loves her job and human society.

characterAbstracts.name: Yumemizuki Mizuki
characterAbstracts.desc: A shareholder of Aisa Bathhouse, a baku, and a clinical psychologist. Dedicated to the dispersal of nightmares, and to bringing people peace of mind.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Transience
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Transience is the dream of the nation of thunder.
The fleeting nature of this mortal world is the essence of beauty, for are our lives in this world not akin to the levin flash? Yet the might of the divine comes suddenly, and before the roar of eternity, who can stand?

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Transience
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Transience is the dream of the nation of thunder.
We find the greatest joys in mortal life in transient dreams, for is life itself not like the shadow of the thunder? Pursue your dreams into the clouds if you wish, and enjoy the unexpected silence of the dim lamp-lit nights.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Transience
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Transience is the dream of the nation of thunder.
Fleeting glories are the highest expression of mortal beauty, for are we mortals not like the flashing lightning itself? Like a lovely dream or blossoming spark, we shall leave a gorgeous mark on the eternal night sky.

characterAbstracts.name: Qiqi
characterAbstracts.desc: An apprentice and herb gatherer at Bubu Pharmacy. An undead with a bone-white complexion, she seldom has much in the way of words or emotion.

characterAbstracts.name: Ningguang
characterAbstracts.desc: The Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing. Her wealth is unsurpassed in all of Teyvat.

characterAbstracts.name: Keqing
characterAbstracts.desc: The Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing. Keqing has much to say about Rex Lapis's unilateral approach to policymaking in Liyue — but in truth, gods admire skeptics such as her quite a lot.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Shenhe
characterAbstracts.desc: An adepti disciple with a most unusual air about her. Having spent much time cultivating in isolation in Liyue's mountains, she has become every bit as cool and distant as the adepti themselves.

characterAbstracts.name: Xiao
characterAbstracts.desc: A yaksha adeptus who defends Liyue. Also heralded as the "Conqueror of Demons" and "Vigilant Yaksha."

characterAbstracts.name: Yelan
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious person who claims to work for the Ministry of Civil Affairs, but is a "non-entity" on the Ministry of Civil Affairs' list.

characterAbstracts.name: Gaming
characterAbstracts.desc: Guard of the Sword and Strongbox Secure Transport Agency, and the head of the "Mighty Mythical Beasts" Wushou troupe.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Prosperity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Prosperity is the people's pursuit in the land of Geo.
Prosperity is Liyue's past, present, and future. This prosperity is unmatched and unobtainable by any other nations — it all belongs to Liyue and its inhabitants.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Prosperity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Prosperity is the people's pursuit in the land of Geo.
Prosperity is the promise made by Liyue to its children: To repay the hard-working laborers with enough gold to brighten up this land.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Prosperity
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Prosperity is the people's pursuit in the land of Geo.
Prosperity is the blessing of Liyue, it is the foundation of the great city built by the gods and the people of Liyue, and it is the source of the peace and safety of the land.

characterAbstracts.name: Lisa
characterAbstracts.desc: The languid but knowledgeable Librarian of the Knights of Favonius, deemed by Sumeru Akademiya to be their most distinguished graduate in the past two centuries.

characterAbstracts.name: Kaeya
characterAbstracts.desc: An accomplished swordsman and a strategic thinker in the Knights of Favonius, rumored to hail from beyond Mondstadt.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Anemo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Venti
characterAbstracts.desc: One of the many bards of Mondstadt, who freely wanders the city's streets and alleys.

characterAbstracts.name: Rosaria
characterAbstracts.desc: A sister of the church, though you wouldn't know it if it weren't for her attire. Known for her sharp, cold words and manner, she often works alone.

characterAbstracts.name: Fischl
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious girl who calls herself "Prinzessin der Verurteilung" and travels with a night raven named Oz.

characterAbstracts.name: Albedo
characterAbstracts.desc: A genius known as the Kreideprinz, he is the Chief Alchemist and Captain of the Investigation Team of the Knights of Favonius.

characterAbstracts.name: Mika
characterAbstracts.desc: A young knight born to an ordinary family. He serves as a Front-Line Surveyor in his Company. He is a low-key and cautious character.

characterAbstracts.name: Dahlia
characterAbstracts.desc: Deacon of the Church of Favonius and the Anemo Archon's representative in the church.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Ballad
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Poetry is the soul of the land of the wind.
Poetry is the manifestations of the desire to spread the word. Though nothing is eternal, though nothing will be the same, the wind's poetry will still spread beyond the skies, the land, the seas to every corner of the world.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Ballad
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Poetry is the soul of the land of the wind.
Poetry is the manifestations of the will to encourage. In the dark days, the gales in the streets and alleyways whisper words of fury, like the battle drums, like the low rumbling before the storm.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Ballad
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Poetry is the soul of the land of the wind.
Poetry is the manifestations of beautiful feelings. On a beautiful day, the breezes carry with them poetry that touches the heart of people like the wind caressing the leaves.

characterAbstracts.name: Eula
characterAbstracts.desc: The Spindrift Knight, a scion of the old aristocracy, and the Captain of the Knights of Favonius Reconnaissance Company. The reason for which a descendant of the ancient nobles might join the Knights remains a great mystery in Mondstadt to this very day.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Anemo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Bennett
characterAbstracts.desc: A good-natured adventurer from Mondstadt who's unfortunately extremely unlucky.

characterAbstracts.name: Jean
characterAbstracts.desc: The righteous and rigorous Dandelion Knight, and Acting Grand Master of Mondstadt's Knights of Favonius.

characterAbstracts.name: Mona
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title. Erudite, but prideful.

characterAbstracts.name: Noelle
characterAbstracts.desc: A maid who faithfully serves the Knights of Favonius. She dreams of joining their ranks someday.

characterAbstracts.name: Diluc
characterAbstracts.desc: The tycoon of a winery empire in Mondstadt, unmatched in every possible way.

characterAbstracts.name: Razor
characterAbstracts.desc: A boy who lives among the wolves in Wolvendom of Mondstadt, away from human civilization. As agile as lightning.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Resistance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the land of the wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to allow the future Mondstadt's poetry to freely be that of the wind and be spread across the land.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Resistance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the city of Wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to grant the citizens of Mondstadt the freedom they now enjoy, like the Anemo Archon blowing away the snow, or like Vennessa rising up to fight.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Resistance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the land of the wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to prevent past conflicts from ever being forgotten, like sprouts breaking through the soil, like the eternal wind eroding through stone walls.

characterAbstracts.name: Klee
characterAbstracts.desc: An explosives expert and a regular at the Knights of Favonius's confinement room. Also known as Fleeing Sunlight.

characterAbstracts.name: Aloy
characterAbstracts.desc: Formerly an outcast, now a hunter of unparalleled skill. Ready to do the right thing at any time.

characterAbstracts.name: Amber
characterAbstracts.desc: Always energetic and full of life, Amber's the best — albeit only — Outrider of the Knights of Favonius.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Anemo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Sucrose
characterAbstracts.desc: An alchemist filled with curiosity about all things. She researches bio-alchemy.

characterAbstracts.name: Barbara
characterAbstracts.desc: Every citizen of Mondstadt adores Barbara. She learned the word "idol" from a magazine.

characterAbstracts.name: Tartaglia
characterAbstracts.desc: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe." His name is highly feared on the battlefield.

characterAbstracts.name: Diona
characterAbstracts.desc: A young lady who has inherited trace amounts of non-human blood. She is the incredibly popular bartender of the Cat's Tail tavern.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Freedom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
To sing is one such freedom. To sing on the land created by the Anemo Archon is to send your heart away with the song on the wind.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Freedom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom of travel is one of such. It is the freedom to traverse the land freely without being obstructed.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Freedom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom to live is one of such. It is the freedom to live freely and healthily without concerns of one's own safety.

characterAbstracts.name: Lisa
characterAbstracts.desc: The languid but knowledgeable Librarian of the Knights of Favonius, deemed by Sumeru Akademiya to be their most distinguished graduate in the past two centuries.

characterAbstracts.name: Kaeya
characterAbstracts.desc: An accomplished swordsman and a strategic thinker in the Knights of Favonius, rumored to hail from beyond Mondstadt.

Poetry is the manifestations of beautiful feelings. On a beautiful day, the breezes carry with them poetry that touches the heart of people like the wind caressing the leaves.

characterAbstracts.name: Eula
characterAbstracts.desc: The Spindrift Knight, a scion of the old aristocracy, and the Captain of the Knights of Favonius Reconnaissance Company. The reason for which a descendant of the ancient nobles might join the Knights remains a great mystery in Mondstadt to this very day.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Anemo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Bennett
characterAbstracts.desc: A good-natured adventurer from Mondstadt who's unfortunately extremely unlucky.

characterAbstracts.name: Jean
characterAbstracts.desc: The righteous and rigorous Dandelion Knight, and Acting Grand Master of Mondstadt's Knights of Favonius.

characterAbstracts.name: Mona
characterAbstracts.desc: A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title. Erudite, but prideful.

characterAbstracts.name: Noelle
characterAbstracts.desc: A maid who faithfully serves the Knights of Favonius. She dreams of joining their ranks someday.

characterAbstracts.name: Diluc
characterAbstracts.desc: The tycoon of a winery empire in Mondstadt, unmatched in every possible way.

characterAbstracts.name: Razor
characterAbstracts.desc: A boy who lives among the wolves in Wolvendom of Mondstadt, away from human civilization. As agile as lightning.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Resistance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the land of the wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to allow the future Mondstadt's poetry to freely be that of the wind and be spread across the land.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Resistance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the city of Wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to grant the citizens of Mondstadt the freedom they now enjoy, like the Anemo Archon blowing away the snow, or like Vennessa rising up to fight.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Resistance
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the land of the wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to prevent past conflicts from ever being forgotten, like sprouts breaking through the soil, like the eternal wind eroding through stone walls.

characterAbstracts.name: Klee
characterAbstracts.desc: An explosives expert and a regular at the Knights of Favonius's confinement room. Also known as Fleeing Sunlight.

characterAbstracts.name: Aloy
characterAbstracts.desc: Formerly an outcast, now a hunter of unparalleled skill. Ready to do the right thing at any time.

characterAbstracts.name: Amber
characterAbstracts.desc: Always energetic and full of life, Amber's the best — albeit only — Outrider of the Knights of Favonius.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Geo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Traveler (Anemo)
characterAbstracts.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

characterAbstracts.name: Sucrose
characterAbstracts.desc: An alchemist filled with curiosity about all things. She researches bio-alchemy.

characterAbstracts.name: Barbara
characterAbstracts.desc: Every citizen of Mondstadt adores Barbara. She learned the word "idol" from a magazine.

characterAbstracts.name: Tartaglia
characterAbstracts.desc: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe." His name is highly feared on the battlefield.

characterAbstracts.name: Diona
characterAbstracts.desc: A young lady who has inherited trace amounts of non-human blood. She is the incredibly popular bartender of the Cat's Tail tavern.

materialAbstracts.name: Philosophies of Freedom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
To sing is one such freedom. To sing on the land created by the Anemo Archon is to send your heart away with the song on the wind.

materialAbstracts.name: Guide to Freedom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom of travel is one of such. It is the freedom to traverse the land freely without being obstructed.

materialAbstracts.name: Teachings of Freedom
materialAbstracts.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom to live is one of such. It is the freedom to live freely and healthily without concerns of one's own safety.

epAbstracts.name: Thoma
epAbstracts.desc: The Kamisato Clan's housekeeper. A well-known "fixer" in Inazuma.

epAbstracts.name: Chevreuse
epAbstracts.desc: The captain of the Special Security and Surveillance Patrol, who wears justice as an ever-present seal upon her heart. Her musket shall only ever point at the guilty.

epAbstracts.name: Diona
epAbstracts.desc: A young lady who has inherited trace amounts of non-human blood. She is the incredibly popular bartender of the Cat's Tail tavern.

epAbstracts.name: Kirara
epAbstracts.desc: A courier for Komaniya Express, a delivery company in Inazuma. A nekomata who loves her job and human society.

epAbstracts.name: Rosaria
epAbstracts.desc: A sister of the church, though you wouldn't know it if it weren't for her attire. Known for her sharp, cold words and manner, she often works alone.

epAbstracts.name: Lyney
epAbstracts.desc: A famed Fontainian magician who possesses great stage presence as well as gift of the gab. Audiences are enthralled by his exquisite skills, and they hang on to his every clever word.

epAbstracts.name: Lynette
epAbstracts.desc: A magic assistant of few words, her emotions are as inscrutable as any cat's.

epAbstracts.name: Xianyun
epAbstracts.desc: One of the Mighty and Illuminated Adepti of Jueyun, known as "Cloud Retainer." Expert in all kinds of mechanical contraptions, her heart now turns towards the affairs of the mortal world, through which she walks under the name "Xianyun."

epAbstracts.name: Xiao
epAbstracts.desc: A yaksha adeptus who defends Liyue. Also heralded as the "Conqueror of Demons" and "Vigilant Yaksha."

epAbstracts.name: Xiao
epAbstracts.desc: A yaksha adeptus who defends Liyue. Also heralded as the "Conqueror of Demons" and "Vigilant Yaksha."

epAbstracts.name: Yelan
epAbstracts.desc: A mysterious person who claims to work for the Ministry of Civil Affairs, but is a "non-entity" on the Ministry of Civil Affairs' list.

epAbstracts.name: Diluc
epAbstracts.desc: The tycoon of a winery empire in Mondstadt, unmatched in every possible way.

epAbstracts.name: Diluc
epAbstracts.desc: The tycoon of a winery empire in Mondstadt, unmatched in every possible way.

epAbstracts.name: Candace
epAbstracts.desc: A descendant of King Deshret with an amber left eye. The defender of Aaru Village.

epAbstracts.name: Collei
epAbstracts.desc: A trainee ranger active in Avidya Forest. Behind her enthusiastic words and actions hides a slightly introverted personality.

epAbstracts.name: Gorou
epAbstracts.desc: The great general of Watatsumi Island's forces. He is deeply trusted by his subordinates.

epAbstracts.name: Yun Jin
epAbstracts.desc: A renowned Liyue opera singer who is skilled in both playwriting and singing. Her style is one-of-a-kind, exquisite and delicate, much like the person herself.

epAbstracts.name: Yun Jin
epAbstracts.desc: A renowned Liyue opera singer who is skilled in both playwriting and singing. Her style is one-of-a-kind, exquisite and delicate, much like the person herself.

epAbstracts.name: Fischl
epAbstracts.desc: A mysterious girl who calls herself "Prinzessin der Verurteilung" and travels with a night raven named Oz.

epAbstracts.name: Arataki Itto
epAbstracts.desc: The first and greatest head of the Arataki Gang, famed throughout Inazuma City's Hanamizaka... Wait, what? You've never heard of them? Are you trying to be funny here?

epAbstracts.name: Paimon
epAbstracts.desc:
Paimon, the Best Guide

"That's right! Your fortune is Paimon's fortune! And vice versa, Paimon's fortune is also your fortune."

epAbstracts.name: Lisa
epAbstracts.desc: The languid but knowledgeable Librarian of the Knights of Favonius, deemed by Sumeru Akademiya to be their most distinguished graduate in the past two centuries.

epAbstracts.name: Venti
epAbstracts.desc: One of the many bards of Mondstadt, who freely wanders the city's streets and alleys.

epAbstracts.name: Yoimiya
epAbstracts.desc: Owner of Naganohara Fireworks. Known as "Queen of the Summer Festival," she excels in her craft of creating fireworks that symbolize people's hopes and dreams.

epAbstracts.name: Cyno
epAbstracts.desc: The General Mahamatra in charge of supervising the researchers of the Akademiya. It is said that when he gets down to work, the General Mahamatra is even more efficient than the "Great Vayuvyastra" made by the Kshahrewar.

epAbstracts.name: Raiden Shogun
epAbstracts.desc: Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, who promised the people of Inazuma an unchanging Eternity.

epAbstracts.name: Raiden Shogun
epAbstracts.desc: Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, who promised the people of Inazuma an unchanging Eternity.

epAbstracts.name: Yae Miko
epAbstracts.desc: Lady Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Also serves as the editor-in-chief of Yae Publishing House. Unimaginable intelligence and cunning are hidden under her beautiful appearance.

epAbstracts.name: Yae Miko
epAbstracts.desc: Lady Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Also serves as the editor-in-chief of Yae Publishing House. Unimaginable intelligence and cunning are hidden under her beautiful appearance.

epAbstracts.name: Barbara
epAbstracts.desc: Every citizen of Mondstadt adores Barbara. She learned the word "idol" from a magazine.

epAbstracts.name: Kaveh
epAbstracts.desc: A renowned architect from Sumeru who perhaps cares a bit too much about too many things. He is an aesthete troubled by reality.

epAbstracts.name: Kujou Sara
epAbstracts.desc: A general of the Tenryou Commission. Bold, decisive, and skilled in battle.

epAbstracts.name: Hu Tao
epAbstracts.desc: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

epAbstracts.name: Tartaglia
epAbstracts.desc: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe." His name is highly feared on the battlefield.

epAbstracts.name: Shikanoin Heizou
epAbstracts.desc: A young prodigy detective from the Tenryou Commission. His senses are sharp and his thoughts are clear.

epAbstracts.name: Klee
epAbstracts.desc: An explosives expert and a regular at the Knights of Favonius's confinement room. Also known as Fleeing Sunlight.

epAbstracts.name: Kuki Shinobu
epAbstracts.desc: The capable and reliable deputy leader of the "Arataki Gang." Please note: capable and reliable are not appellations for the "Arataki Gang," but for their deputy leader in specific.

epAbstracts.name: Yanfei
epAbstracts.desc: A well-known legal adviser active in Liyue Harbor. A brilliant young lady in whose veins runs the blood of an illuminated beast.

epAbstracts.name: Amber
epAbstracts.desc: Always energetic and full of life, Amber's the best — albeit only — Outrider of the Knights of Favonius.

epAbstracts.name: Mika
epAbstracts.desc: A young knight born to an ordinary family. He serves as a Front-Line Surveyor in his Company. He is a low-key and cautious character.

epAbstracts.name: Faruzan
epAbstracts.desc: A researcher from "one hundred years ago." She enjoys self-identifying as everyone's senior, and has significant knowledge of ancient scripts and machines of all kinds.

epAbstracts.name: Arlecchino
epAbstracts.desc: "The Knave," Fourth of the Fatui Harbingers. A poised, ruthless diplomat. To the children in the House of the Hearth, she is their feared yet dependable "Father."

epAbstracts.name: Ningguang
epAbstracts.desc: The Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing. Her wealth is unsurpassed in all of Teyvat.

epAbstracts.name: Mona
epAbstracts.desc: A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title. Erudite, but prideful.

epAbstracts.name: Chongyun
epAbstracts.desc: A young exorcist from a family of exorcists. He does everything he can to suppress his abundance of yang energy.

epAbstracts.name: Razor
epAbstracts.desc: A boy who lives among the wolves in Wolvendom of Mondstadt, away from human civilization. As agile as lightning.

epAbstracts.name: Albedo
epAbstracts.desc: A genius known as the Kreideprinz, he is the Chief Alchemist and Captain of the Investigation Team of the Knights of Favonius.

epAbstracts.name: Kamisato Ayaka
epAbstracts.desc: Daughter of the Yashiro Commission's Kamisato Clan. Dignified and elegant, as well as wise and strong.

epAbstracts.name: Xinyan
epAbstracts.desc: Liyue's sole rock 'n' roll musician. She rebels against ossified prejudices using her music and passionate singing.

epAbstracts.name: Sayu
epAbstracts.desc: A pint-sized ninja attached to the Shuumatsuban, who always seems sleep-deprived.

epAbstracts.name: Eula
epAbstracts.desc: The Spindrift Knight, a scion of the old aristocracy, and the Captain of the Knights of Favonius Reconnaissance Company. The reason for which a descendant of the ancient nobles might join the Knights remains a great mystery in Mondstadt to this very day.

epAbstracts.name: Nahida
epAbstracts.desc: A caged bird secluded within the confines of the Sanctuary of Surasthana who can only see the world in her dreams.

epAbstracts.name: Kaedehara Kazuha
epAbstracts.desc: A wandering samurai from Inazuma who is currently with Liyue's Crux Fleet. A gentle and carefree soul whose heart hides a great many burdens from the past.

epAbstracts.name: Xiangling
epAbstracts.desc: A renowned chef from Liyue. She's extremely passionate about cooking and excels at making her signature hot and spicy dishes.

epAbstracts.name: Keqing
epAbstracts.desc: The Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing. Keqing has much to say about Rex Lapis's unilateral approach to policymaking in Liyue — but in truth, gods admire skeptics such as her quite a lot.

epAbstracts.name: Wriothesley
epAbstracts.desc: Duke of the Fortress of Meropide, Lord Incognito of the murky depths.

epAbstracts.name: Sucrose
epAbstracts.desc: An alchemist filled with curiosity about all things. She researches bio-alchemy.

epAbstracts.name: Kaeya
epAbstracts.desc: An accomplished swordsman and a strategic thinker in the Knights of Favonius, rumored to hail from beyond Mondstadt.

epAbstracts.name: Ganyu
epAbstracts.desc: The secretary at Yuehai Pavilion. The blood of the qilin, an illuminated beast, flows within her veins.

epAbstracts.name: Nilou
epAbstracts.desc: The star of the Zubayr Theater. She is full of warmth and innocence, and her dances are lively and elegant.

epAbstracts.name: Neuvillette
epAbstracts.desc: The Chief Justice of Fontaine, known as the Iudex, is renowned for his unassailable impartiality.

epAbstracts.name: Layla
epAbstracts.desc: A Rtawahist student who specializes in Theoretical Astrology. Heavily prone to somnambulism and locked in a grinding war with sleep deprivation, the problem of restful slumber is a most troubling one to her.

epAbstracts.name: Dori
epAbstracts.desc: An elusive merchant who has a fondness for glittering Mora.

epAbstracts.name: Tighnari
epAbstracts.desc: A young researcher well-versed in botany who currently serves as a Forest Watcher in Avidya Forest. He is a straight shooter with a warm heart - and a dab hand at guiding even the dullest of pupils.

epAbstracts.name: Zhongli
epAbstracts.desc: A mysterious expert contracted by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.
